description:
Castagna is a must.  The whole experience from service to food was excellent.  The owner, chef, server is all one man, who was charming, attentive, and he's a really good cook.

We started off with the fois gras, caprese salad and carrot soup.  The fois gras was some of the best I've ever had, and I've had it in France.  The homemade cheese in the caprese salad was perfect.  Slightly salty, creamy inside and firm on the outside.  Then we shared the beef daube with pasta.  The meat was cooked to perfection, it melted in your mouth.  For desert we had the Fondant au chocolat.

We are looking forward to our next visit.  If we lived in the area we would be regulars.
author: Jan F.

description:
Very pricy for the quality of the food. Do not order the steak tartare, the cheeses or the filet mignon... The supposed bernaisse sauce it's just a joke. It's was spicy! WTF! totally disgusting....

I enjoyed the onion soup (very good!), the wine and the tap water... nothing else....
author: María J.

description:
Atmosphere - 5
Ambience - 5
Menu selection - 3
Taste - 3
Cost - 3
Service - 3

Dined here during a visit to SF while taking a few out of town friends sightseeing in the city. The YELP review s drew up to this restaurant as we were searching for a place in the Marina District.

The restaurant is quaint with less than 10 tables, seems to have a great selection of wine (but we don't drink), and a very pleasant modern Parisian feel to it. The baguette was tasty and timely as we were starving. Considering we were the only ones waiting to be served it took a long time to be served. 

The Mom's Lasagne was the main hit, it was tasty and delicate. My salad, which I asked for chicken on top, was plain and the chicken slices were super over cooked and dry!! A one star for that. The portions for the pasta was so small that our friends had to grab a cup of soup shortly after we had lunch here!! 

All together, I felt if you are her for an afternoon wine and appetizer, it is a decent place, but nothing memorable...
author: Mehrnaz H.

description:
A tiny little place with awesome food.

I really enjoyed the duck and their recommendation for wine was spot on. Very cozy little place too. I would say no more than 10 tables and a bar. 

It reminded me of so many places in Paris that you can walk into and feel warm and happy and have a good meal no matter what you choose on the menu. 

You can use YELP reservations to book in advance too. Very conveniant.
author: Corey Tess T.

description: The service is very slow....we spent 2 hours here with half of the restaurant empty... And our crepe was served with no cream and fruits..... Very disappointed by the dessert! it looks super different from all the posts by others from google. And after we mentioned, the waitress then added the cream. How can you get a crepe without cream at a high rating French restaurant?????? Interesting......
author: Lia L.

description: This cute little French place was absolutely amazing. The food was delicious, and the environment even better. You are serviced by the chef himself and he makes you feel so very welcome. I enjoyed my time here, the chef is very friendly and funny, the food is amazing, and the environment is just absolutely beautiful and romantic. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a delicious meal as well as a quiet night out with the family.
author: Brookie L.

description:
Surprised that I've never noticed this quaint restaurant at the end of Chestnut. It had a French cafe feel and the food and service were great. 

Clearly the owner and chef is super passionate about this restaurant and his food. I got the lasagna and it was hearty and saucy. Could resist the French fries either that came in a chalice. 

Cool spot to hang out for a casual dinner. Easy to strike up a convo with other people at the bar. Felt like a brief moment outside of busy SF.
author: Young Y.

description:
You're gonna have a marvelous night :)

French chef, welcoming crew, delicious food. What more can one ask for?

(Probably a lot actually... but let's just go with it haha.)

I had made reservations for 7:00pm on Valentine's Day, and I was a little nervous about the night as my choice the year before ended up feeling like lining up for TSA security, being violated a little, and then being left a little confused and wondering why we signed up for this as we put our shoes back on.

Castagna was so much better!! We were cheerfully welcomed (because we had reservations haha) and were given complimentary champagne and salmon cream bites while they prepared our table. While waiting, we noticed that the bar seating had a really great view of the kitchen - and being a wannabe-chef, I asked if we could sit at the bar and have personal attention and glorious food views.

She said yes ;)

So she went with the prix fixe of the mushroom soup + scallops, and I went with the standard filet mignon with fries. We also would get a bottle of champagne (the chef went, "...? .... Let's do this!") and the Tarte Tatin - which is like fancy apple pie. And here we go with food!

MUSHROOM SOUP
Creamy mushroom soup! Everything you would expect, done in a very reliable fashion. Our soup was a teensy-bit on the lukewarm side, but I try not to be too hard on a super busy Valentine's Day :) On a sidenote, the bread is really good too!

SCALLOPS
So I actually can't eat scallops due to allergies, but I heard it was really good (it definitely looked magnificent!) and is worth getting again. With everything else so good, I would imagine this was correct :)

FILET MIGNON
Honestly, Castagna's version has become one of my favorite steaks (if not, my actual favorite). The flavor is really satisfying yet clean, and the bites just melt in your mouth. The crust could be a little thicker/crunchier (then I would probably be broke... and fat.... but happy!), but it's simply amazing. Better than my experiences at Ruth's Chris and even Alexander's (though not by much on this one haha)!

TARTE TATIN
I love apple pie, and we didn't know how this would turn out. But it had baked apples so how could we go wrong? I know most people probably go for the crème brûlée, and I'm sure it's probably fantastic here - I guess I prefer fruit and sorbets over caramels and creams (but I'll get it next time!). The tarte tatin had really rich flavor, sweet but not overly so, and was a perfect ending for the meal.

So the place is definitely on the small side (so make your reservations if you can), and parking in the area isn't the best (though we used a nearby $3/hr garage which isn't too bad), but you definitely owe to yourself to stop by Castagna and visit Chef Stéphane! It's won awards, is the favorite  restaurant of many fellow Yelpers, and you're going to see why so many regulars keep coming back :)

Thanks again for a wonderful evening, and see you next time for lasagna!!
author: Greg G.

description: Fantastic food, ambiance and service! This little gem I feel like I've walked by a million times. I'm happy I finally went in to give it a shot. We ordered 3 appetizers, 2 main courses and desserts. It was a knock out of the park for every dish. We'll be back soon!
author: Amber S.

description:
Came here on a whim with my sis and the fambam. It was after Christmas so the whole Marina was pretty dead - which was awesome! My sis is good friends with the owner/chef so that was nice. Not only that, Stéphane was very accommodating and welcoming towards my nephew who is autistic. He sat us where my nephew would be comfortable and gave us fries (the nephew's fave) quickly. For me, it was very heartwarming. I always love supporting restaurants who accommodate families with special children/people. 

I highly suggest making a reservation - the place is tiny but cute inside. It's not your typical dark wanting to be romantic French place. It's actually very inviting and a nice balance lighting. 

We ended up ordering a few dishes since it was our first big meal after breakfast. The sis ordered a cheese plate and Marguerita pizza as our starters. The pizza was thin crust and it was awesome! The right amount of crispiness as well as flavor. For my main, I ordered a lasagna - which, unfortunately, I wasn't able to fully enjoy since it was hella hot. I ended up getting it to go. 

Overall, it was a nice experience and everyone was happy and comfortable. Ordering two nice bottles of wine helped as well :) Looking forward to the next rendezvous here!
author: Cath M.

description:
We had a large group of friends meet up for our monthly dinner club at Castagna.  I had never heard of it before so I was excited to check it out especially with all of the great reviews.  I had a good experience and I enjoyed my meal of the french onion soup (love it) and the filet.  The service was very friend;y.  Unfortunately the salmon special that most people had at the table didn't live up to the hype.  My wife's had a ton of bones and it wasn't very flavorful.  The chef's crepes made up for it though as I think each of us could have gotten our own and devoured it.

I'd recommend coming to this quaint spot but would order off of the tried and true menu versus one of the specials.
author: Blake B.

description:
The right play for any weekend when the sun is out in the Marina.

Provençal is a reliable crowd-pleaser and these folks do it right. Service is attentive but relaxed, they'll speak a little French with you if you care to join the fun, and all the needful staples are available.

For our lazy late afternoon Saturday lunch we went with a kir and a salad each. Not five-star territory on the price point, but very nice meals with very nice ingredients, and in generous portions. Bigger and better than at many other French bistros, and with a much nicer patio in a much nicer neighborhood than I can find elsewhere in SF. Like other reviewers on here, I wandered in here without it being my original intended destination, but given how everything came out I didn't feel deprived at all; I think I was happier here than anywhere else I could have wound up.

I'm glad this one is here, and I'm sure I'll be back.
author: James D.

description:
The place is tiny - seats maybe 20 people with only 3 or 4 people working in the entire place. The ambiance is intimate and romantic. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by our server and even Chef Stéphane. We immediately felt welcomed and I knew right away that it was going to be an amazing experience. 

We started off by ordering a bottle of wine, our servers recommendation and it was fabulous.  We also got a french onion soup to share. It was bubbly, hot, cheesy. Everything you could want in french onion soup. It's worth mentioning that the french bread that was served at the table was delicious and warm and was the perfect vessel to sop up every last drop of the soup. For my main course, I got a pasta dish (new to the menu so it's not online yet and I don't remember what it was called) but it was amazing! White sauce pasta with prosciutto and a piece of fried prosciutto on top - creamy, rich and delicious. My boyfriend got the lasagne. All I can say about it is WOW. Probably the best lasagne I've had. I would definitely order both dishes again.  We polished off both plates and proceeded to order creme brûlée for dessert.  The creme brûlée was, to no surprise, amazing as well. 

We finished the night off with an amazing send off from the waitstaff and the chef, leaving us full and satisfied and in an incredibly happy mood. We could tell Chef Stéphane takes great pride in his food and his art, as he was perfectly attentive the entire evening, ensuring everyone had an amazing experience.

I am already looking forward to visiting Castagna and Chef Stéphane again. Incredible service, incredible food, incredible wine - I really couldn't ask for anything else.  

Très magnifique!
author: Kristin E.

description:
Delicious food and lovely people!
They were absolutely full despite making a reservation days ahead - our table was not ready for 15 minutes but they did their best to care for us. I ran into a friend and they were very accommodating, and he told me their usual chef was sick. Everyone seemed relaxed and happy anyway.
The food itself was mostly delicious, especially the beef dishes. There was a mistake with my GF crepe Ratatouille so they gladly made me another dish. We polished off most everything.

Thanks for making our night our a lovely experience.
author: Evonne H.

description:
Definitely a place to frequently visit. 
French onion soup
Prime New York 
Napa cab franc 
Oh yeah, and the fondant au Chocolat
All delicious 
The burger came out while waiting for my food and will definitely be getting that next time. 
Solid service, great menu and good wine lineup
author: M Z.

description:
Amazing little place in the marina. I was welcomed by the owner and sat close to the kitchen. Thought I had the worst seat of the house, but to my surprise, it was the best!
I could see the food being prepared, the owner was a natural entertainer, and everyone was friendly and nice.
Food is amazing. Has a carpaccio, steak au poivre, wine and a great chocolate hot cake for dessert. 6 stars!!!!!!
author: Paulo C.

description:
Yay, another Sunday brunch! Of course, a lot of the brunch places around Marina District were super packed, but I found a nice little French bistro to enjoy a meal. It seemed that I was the first to dine this morning, and so I had the whole restaurant to myself for a little bit, before others started rolling in. 

These were baked eggs with crême fraiche (shame on me and all 12 years of French I studied - didn't know that was sour cream haha), with a side of potatoes and lightly dressed salad. I went for the baked eggs in the spirit of trying new things/not being boring old Croque Madame, which is what I was debating between. The potatoes were definitely excellent. The crispy coating seemed to be executed with great care, as it was extremely even all the way around. 

I also ordered a mimosa because why not XD I think the server thought it was a bit curious that I was having a mimosa, also considering I was having brunch with me, myself, and I hehe. I've actually never tried a mimosa before, so this was my first. I just don't think I like alcohol, because I wished it was more orange juice than champagne. I guess I'll just stick with juice next time haha. Oh well, it's all about trying new things right? :)

Since I sat facing the window, I noticed a couple posters that mentioned the chef was featured in Grocery Games, which was pretty cool. Anyways, it was definitely a delightful Sunday brunch, and I hope to return to try other things on the menu.
author: Joanna C.

description:
Castagna offers a French take on Italian entrees in a cozy, intimate setting around the Marina. Contrary to what most other reviewers have reported on, unfortunately my experience was pretty lackluster. Not sure this place really lives up to the hype.

The menu is very carb heavy, including entrees like pizza, pasta, etc. They seem to be well known for their pasta here, so maybe my friend and I just happened to order the wrong dishes. Overall the food is decent and average, but honestly pretty overpriced. This is more of a $$$ place than $$.

Filet Mignon au Poivre - Pretty small chunk of steak, good sauce but hardly filled me up. I replaced the side of fries with salad, and sadly was still left hungry after that. For $32, this didn't feel worth it at all unless the portions are a bit bigger and there's more to this dish such as roasted veggies, more sides, etc.

My friend has the Parma pizza which she mentioned was good but not great. I guess we got pretty ordinary run of the mill entrees and had bad luck. I don't think I'd come back.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
I made a reservation here for dinner for my boyfriends birthday. When we arrived we were the only people in the restaurant, so it was a bit awkward, but soon it started to fill up. Our waiter, who turned out to be the owner, was very friendly and gave us lots of time to pick out our entrees. We shared the cheese plate, which was so yummy, and they gave us extra bread. My only complaint for the cheese plate was the amount if bleu cheese we were given. There was so much for such a strong cheese, so it was tough to finish.
For dinner I chose the pesto pasta, and my boyfriend chose the beef stew. He said his stew was delicious and very tender and flavorful. 

My pasta was nothing to write home about, it was simple but didn't really wow me, this is the reason the review is 4 stars and not 5. 

For dessert we chose the Chocolate Budino, not really knowing what it was, but I love chocolate. Imagine my surprise when it turns out to be a chocolate soufflé! And oh my goodness was it good! It came with an orange sauce and this delicious salted creme. This dessert was one of the best I've had, and it was such a treat! 

Overall I liked the friendly staff, delicious desserts, and the location. I will have to come back and try a different entree next time!
author: Larissa S.

description:
The staff greeted me with a smile and handed my pick-up order of beef tartare over with the greatest of care. I was longing for good customer service. Thank you. 

Beef tartare is one of my favorite foods, and I've had a lot of it. Castagna's rendition is overall good. I'd suggest eliminating the cabbage and going easy on the oil.
author: Paulina F.

description: My wife and I made a reservation here through Yelp for both of our birthdays. The restaurant isn't huge but it's definitely a comfortable environment. The owner is really polite, friendly, and is attentive to the needs of his clients. My wife ordered the filet mignon and I ordered the steak, both were excellent. My wife and I enjoyed our meal and the quality time together. Thank you for the birthday dessert!
author: Felipe V.

description:
We loved the atmosphere, the staff and especially the food. The swordfish special was amazing but the lasagna was truly to die for. Lots of melted
Cheese and meat and little ricotta and pasta. I was jealous of the next door tables French onion soup. I would highly recommend this cozy little place.
author: Scott W.

description:
A warm welcome by the owner, great food from the South of France... it's so tasty! 
Highly recommended !
author: Cathy D.

description: Chef has this place feeling like a meal with family. The atmosphere is cozy and the staff is stellar. We found this gem the best way possible, totally by accident and returned again the next evening. First visit we enjoyed a wonderful Sancere, muscles frite and the lamb burger special, all presented perfectly. Next evening we had to come back for the lasagna we saw at the next table the night before (and for the hospitality, of course) and the seafood pasta with an amazing bottle of bubbly. Dessert-well let just say we would stop in for dessert and espresso again & again! Thank you Stephane and staff for your warmth and clear genius in the kitchen, we loved every minute and look forward to coming back again when we visit this incredible city from New York
author: Michelle T.

description: First time visit but def not the last. Came to dinner with friends to celebrate a birthday. The cheese plate was divine to share as an appetizer. I had the pasta. Full of flavor and so satisfying. The service was amazing and the chef was charming and personally greeted us.  The atmosphere is just so relaxing and beautiful. Definitely recommending the restaurant.
author: Oana T.

description: I have a mixed review on this place. First, the menu is small. They don't serve fountain soda, only coke in a bottle, sparking water, and wine.Water is from the tap and there is no ice in the restaurant. So the water was warm when drinking it. The white cream pasta made with prosciutto is what I ordered except I got chicken instead of the prosciutto. My pasta was delish but portion size is smaller than the norm. My husband really disliked his lasagna which I tried, and also didn't think it was very flavorful. It's overpriced for sure. The garlic and parsley fries were very good though. Definitely get a side or aioli and ketchup with them. Service was phenomenal though, which is always GREATLY appreciated. The inside only seats maybe 15 people, a total of five tables.
author: Kelley W.

description:
I would have given this 1 star because of the poor service we received, but to be fair, the food was ok enough to bump it up to 2 stars. So let's start there. My wife and I got:
- Mussels: Best dish we had at Castagna. While the mussels were a tad smaller than we like and a few of them were a bit rubber-y, overall this was a good dish because (1) the amount of mussels for the price they charged was fair; but more significantly (2) because the sauce was outstanding. Just the right amount so that it didn't overpower the mussels but enhanced them with the great flavour (we actually ended up treating the sauce like a 'soup', just having it by itself)
- Lasagna: When a restaurant slaps on a "grandmother recipe" label on one of its dishes, I'm automatically getting it. This one was ok, though it didn't live up to the expectations that the label brings. The lasagna meat and noodles were generically good, but I liked the cheese the most - crisped nicely so that it complemented the good helping of sauce.
- Seafood pasta: Just ok. Fair helping of seafood, good pasta firmness, but sauce was just a bit bland for me.

So overall, the food was ok - I've had better, I've had worse. I'd probably give Catagna 3 stars if i based it solely on this. But because of the service, I am downgrading the overall rating. The service we received was really bad:
- Slow: We waited for 45 minutes before we got anything (not even complimentary bread, let alone the actual appetizers/mains we ordered)... and this is after we had told one of the servers to bring the food as they were ready. 
- A bit forgetful: My wife had to remind them to bring the rose she ordered, and that didn't get to her till after we started eating. 
- Rude: One of our friends wrote a review on Yelp while we were at the restaurant. Now whether you agree with this practice or not is not the point here. Because as we were paying the bill, the manager/owner(?) came to our table and just bluntly asked if we had a problem. We were confused since it was abrupt and we were in the middle of conversations, and I guess he saw the look on our faces because he then proceeded to ask "Is there a ___ at this table?" After we pointed to our friend, he then took out his phone and showed us the review our friend had just made. Now the act of getting immediate feedback from your customers (whether they are satisfied/dissatisfied) is not bad, and in fact could be a sign of great customer service. But he went about it in such an abrasive manner, and rather than asking us what was wrong with the meal/experience in a tone which showed openness to feedback, he was very defensive and kept trying to justify their poor service. To be fair, he did end the conversation by offering dessert/drinks on the house, but at that point we had lost our appetites... and it wasn't because of the food we just had.

I know there are a lot of good reviews here for Castagna so I'll just say this: You can say we have different tastes and not trust my take on it's food. You can say maybe things were busy and maybe 45 minutes isn't a long time to wait for any food to come, so can chalk up the slow service to an off-day or personal timing expectations. But you can't say that customers don't deserve a certain level of respect from the restaurants they frequent. That, more than anything, is where Castagna failed. And I hope they try and truly take this feedback to heart.
author: David Y.

description: Such a gem! Both the food & service were top of the line. I came with a party of seven, everyone ordered a different entree & we all loved our food. The french onion soup was the best I have ever had. The service was so wonderful, the owner Stephane is friendly & passionate - we loved him! Very cute decor, great vibes from the staff & mouthwatering food - I couldn't ask for more!
author: Patricia B.

description:
This place was delicious! I came here with my BF last night around 6:30pm, and although the spot is pretty small, they had 1-2 tables available so we got seated right away. We ordered the mussels, tuna tar tar, filet mignon, and the french onion soup. Everything was delicious. The mussels and tuna tar tar were probably my favorites, but the steak and soup were a close second. We ordered two different glasses of wine, which were also very good.

We will definitely be back.
author: Sam C.

description:
Came here for dinner on a Saturday night.  Overall it was pretty good but I felt the menu was limited - and noticeably the foie gras wasn't listed.  I had the duck confit which was pretty good, but nothing to rave about.  My husband started with the fig and prosciutto salad which was pretty good, and he ordered the pistou pasta which was good but a very small portion size.

With all the restaurants available in the city, likely won't be back any time soon.
author: Siv L.

description: Ate here for the second time, and their food hasn't failed once.  We had the mussels marinere with garlic fries, seafood pasta (frutti  de mare), and the filet mignon.  Mussels were nice soft and buttery with that delicious wine sauce, and paired well with the garlic fries (wish they served bread so we can dip that in the wine sauce to eat).  The seafood pasta had fresh seafood sauteed in a tomato wine sauce, served with fresh fettuccine, and the fettuccine had great texture.  The filet mignon was the star of the night and was nice and juice and tender, cooked medium rare perfectly.  It didn't have that gamey taste like some filet mignons in other places, which was a huge plus.  The space is a big small and air circulation could improve, but overall a solid french food place in the heart of the cow hollow/marina area.  4.5 stars even though I put 4.
author: Raymond F.

description: This was a first visit and we would definitely recommend to others. Stephane, chef and owner, was gracious and spent time reviewing wine choices with us. He is fun and very knowledgeable. And above all, the food was quite memorable.
author: Carol J.

description: Came here for date nite and was very happy to choose this place food was delicious and the service was awesome very satisfied will come back and try more stuff
author: Raul C.

description:
Sunday Morning-woke up starving for a croque monsieur . Looked up a few places and settled
on this subtle gem of a restaurant, way across town ( for us Lower Haighters)  in the Marina.
We weren't sure if the place was open , as it was very quiet. 
Ordered aforementioned croque monsieurs, and a Panache - Brits call it a Shandy- half beer, half Limonade , lunch-perfect light beer. It verged on emotional.I fought the urge to stand up and yell " This is the best French food I've had in 20 years!! We introduced  ourselves to the very Sud French chef, whose simple , and exquisite dishes were off the charts. 
I'm not trying to be a jerk by mentioning that I lived in Paris and Brussels for several years and have lunched a lot in my day. I just want you to know that I was impressed by the quality and talent of the charming, and very
funny chef.
author: heather K.

description:
Enjoyed our meals and service was excellent. 10/10 

I had the croque monsieur which was very very good and added aside of fries. Also yummy!

Hubby had the Niçoise salad which he enjoyed 

Daughters had the caramelized French toast and my other had the carbonara pasta which we all agreed was 10/10

Would  return. It's a small place probably seats 10-12 but it was pretty empty at noon on a Sunday. Not sure why but I'm hoping they get more business later in the day.  This place is a must!
author: Christy K.

description: Let's start with the atmosphere. Loved it-5. Ambiance-5. Menu selection limited but what do you expect in a place with, at most 10 tables. The food met all expectations, service stop on and Cost, very reasonable.  Will go back on my next trip to S.F.
author: John W.

description:
The filet mignon is easily five stars. Better than Ruth's Chris verision. The Castagna steak peppercorn sauce is amazing.

But, I went here because they serve 'daube', a somewhat obscure French beef stew. I was excited to try it but I can only give their daube three stars. It was good, not great.

My mom's version is physically ugly (a casserole, basically) and Catagna's is much more aesthetically appealing, a stew-based pasta. 

My mom's version uses mashed potatoes as the carb, spread on top of long-cooked beef. Castagna uses really good noodles (five stars for the noodles, prolly made in house) as the vessel for the beef. But my mom's version of daube is way more tasty. It just is.

I'll still go back, but next time I'll reorder the filet mignon and try the lasagna. Also, the crêpes with house-made jam were very tasty; just didn't have enough jam and the end was burnt. I would say they're a cross between street crêpes and what I consider more authentically home-style crêpes. I favor the latter and have never come across them in SF.
author: Maya B.

description:
Food was very good.  I had the filet mignon and wanted it with fries but their fryer wasn't working so I got it with roasted potatoes instead.  Which was good.  I also wanted it with the Bernaise sauce but they didn't have that either.  The chef was really nice and came to our table and asked me about other sauces he could make for me.  He ended up making me a delicious mushroom sauce.  The waitress working there was terrible!  She left us waiting for like 15 minutes and forgot about us when the bill came.... we kept looking back at her and she never noticed.

Update:  the owner invited me back and everything was great, including the service!! Would definitely go back and I definitely recommend this place.  The owner/chef is super nice and definitely wants you to be happy!
author: Julia W.

description: Remarkable place. Been here, 2 adults+3 kids, 4 days ago, and just had to write a review... The food was great, Stephane  was a remarcable host, and we had a unique experience, embracing fun and a culinary trip to Nice, France... Chapeau!
author: Robb Y.

description:
Today is 2/24 and we came back and again had an amazing meal, thanks to Stephan and his team. We ordered the pizza which was a good appetizer, very flavorful. We also had glasses of the aperitif wines which were delicious. Filet mignon and the lasagna were incredible - the sauce on the filet is heaven! 



Tonight was beyond perfect. Stephan was gracious, we were never rushed, the food came out perfect, and had a personal touch to the evening. We started out with the French onion soup, then the filet mignon and lasagna, concluded with crème brûlée, The Bordeaux was also delicious. 

Hands-down a hidden gem, i'm still dreaming about the crème brûlée. Can't wait to come back!
author: Sherrylyn F.

description: Food was savory and delicious..staff was a ton of fun! It's a cozy spot and if you have to wait..there are funky bars all around.
author: Amy C.

description: Truly one of the more rewarding culinary experiences of my life. The owner/head chef works his ass off to ensure that every guest leaves satisfied, he goes so far as to check every plate as It leaves the kitchen and no detail is too small. You cannot go wrong here no matter what you order. Sit at the bar if you can so that you can watch the magic happen- best seat in the house. I cannot wait until I am back in San Francisco so that I can visit this masterpiece again. Thank you Stephane!!!
author: Bret S.

description:
Invite yourself to this intimate space that does what it can to highlight the food. The servers were fast moving, fast talking, and with a no-BS attitude when it came down to dinner. The menu at first seemed non-inclusive and on the limited side, but once the dishes came descending down onto the table, all doubts were erased. It was all so good.

The bread to start was simple and perhaps not so impressive to the eyes, but it was served warm and soft with a strong olive oil. They're generous about refilling the bread basket, so by all means, don't be shy to ask for more. The tuna tartare was delicately diced tuna mixed with bits of onion and herbs and dressed with what seemed like a ponzu sauce for a bit of asian flair. The fried chips were delicate and crisp, a perfect contrast to the fish. 

Dinner continued with the marguerita pizza, a thin crusted pie with not too much tomato sauce or mozzarella, and therefore on the drier side. It was light and refreshing. The beef stew with pasta was a saucy dish that wasn't actually soupy but just moist enough to give life to bouncy ribbon pasta. The chunks of beef were tender and broken-down.

I'm no expert on French cuisine and so can't speak to what region of France the food is from or if it was authentic by any means, but each dish was very lovingly concocted and it clearly showed.
author: Cici T.

description:
17.12.20.    1st visit

Food - 4 1/2
Ambiance - 4
Service - 4 1/2


Foie Gras
     Very good ... As expected of foie gras
     Accentuated w crushed peppercorn and
            Possibly juniper berry
     Freshly made brioche
     Blueberry compote to offset the richness

Beef Stew w pasta
     Pretty good beef stew sitting on top of ...
     Silky smooth pasta ... Mostly like fresh pasta

Next time I will try the following ...
     Lasagna ... Grandma Recipe
     Frutti de Mare pasta
When I am in the area.

I always believe in smaller restaurants ...
    The chef have more control and usually
      there to QC the food coming out.
author: S.K. Y.

description: Cozy ambiance and great food and wine.  We came here on a Wednesday night for dinner when we didn't feel up to cooking. The dining room is small and we were greeted by the owner and served warmed bread when we walked in. We split a pizza and the beef soup, a bottle of french wine, and creme brûlée for dessert, all the dishes were excellent. Made us feel like we were back in Europe - we'll definitely be coming back.
author: Mary P.

description: Probably the best french restaurant in the city. Prices are reasonable and the food is spectacular.
author: Bruno D.

description: Every dish was delicious beyond my imagination. We started with the mussels were fantastic, especially with the bread they provided.
author: Emma L.

description: Good food and sense of humour from Owner, we enjoyed the atmosphere from our next table neighbour's birthday party, eventhough a little loud
author: Michael L.

description:
Chef and owner, Stéphane, is a very gracious host, and you get the sense that his restaurant is his labor of love. He made our dinner very memorable by making sure we are not just diners, but his guests for the evening. 

The place is small and intimate with a warm, modern ambiance. The staff were very friendly to younger guest. While this is not the place for loud, playful children to run around (those places are called parks), if your child can sit through dinner quietly enough as not to disturb other guests, this restaurant is quite family friendly, and willing to accommodate the needs and curiosity of our 4 year old son. Stéphane served up a beautifully peeled carrot to satisfy his simple palate, and invited him to the kitchen to show him how sugar is melted to form the hard, top crust of the crème brûlée.

Some of our favorite foods of the night were the scallops special served with a very savory rice, the French onion soup, and the crème brûlée. 

There are a lot of places for delicious food in SF, but places where the proprietor makes you feel like you are his personal guest is a rare treat.
author: Bobby L.

description: Castagna is one to come back to.  I had the Sea Bass... incroyable!  Nice and cozy environment with a great selection of wine.  Must try the crème brûlée.  The owner/host/chef has such an amazing personality and a real passion for good food.
author: Azar B.

description:
I would have given this place 5 starts if not one accident happened at the end. 
We ordered full course from the soup to entree. The food was really good, the atmosphere in the restaurant was very nice and cozy on top of a very cute interior design.  
Finally we ordered desert and coffee. Coffee was brought right away, desert never came. 
I must emphasize that our server was really nice, hospitable and was focused on customer service thought out the entire evening. 
When we saw the desert to be included in the check, we kindly asked the server to remove it. After that the cook just went off, yelling from the kitchen at her trying to force her to give it to us and make us pay for it. He spoke Spanish, but we understood everything he said. And they were not kind words. We left feeling frustrated and guilty.
author: Taisiya P.

description: WOW...... What a great little gem hidden in a small neighborhood... only seats 20, so get there early. We started out with the mixed green salad and garlic fries, migrated to the French Onion soup, Seafood pasta paired with a fine wine. The owner chef was quite personable and made the evening quite enjoyable. The food speaks volume about his compassion. We wrapped the evening up with his  Creme Brûlée, absolutely spot on....We live out of state but will definitely stop in on our next trip to San Fran.... Please do not hesitate to visit Stephan for great food and a great experience.....
author: George M.

description: Excellent French Food! Great wine selection, good range of French cuisine. Everything is expertly prepared by an amazing chef. Prices are very reasonable. Make sure to make a reservation, you will not be disappointed.
author: Rich M.

description: My love and I celebrated our three year anniversary at Castagna. It was a beautiful experience and extremely personal. The owner was very welcoming and attentive. The food and wine were absolutely delicious. We will definitely be back again. Highly recommend for a romantic night or celebration!
author: Kiara M.

description: Excellent food and outstanding service!  Tuna tartare was a great appetizer.  Veal burger was very tasty!  Shared 3 of their pasta dishes and would order them again!  Definitely going back!
author: John R.

description: This is not only our favorite restaurant in the Marina, but in all of SF! The food is always fresh and fantastic..not to mention the service. A relaxed, passionate restaurant that never disappoints
author: Parker G.

description:
It's a nice cozy place with a good selection of wines. The owner is also the waiter and is a nice French guy with all the trimmings like talking to you in French and reminding you every time that Nice in France is the best place in the world. The biggest shame is that the best thing about Nice is Socca which he doesn't serve, but that's neither there or here. 

The pizzas are great and highly recommended, they're thin Italian and French style and the best in the area. For the more adventurous there is the daube with pasta which is like a beef stew, although last I had, the beef could have been stewed for longer as it was a tad too chewy and I feel like there could have been more pasta. 

Desert was good although the apple part of the tarte tatin should have been more caramelized but I really enjoyed the homemade whipped berry cream that came with it.
author: William M.

description:
As we were considering the menu outside, a guy ran up and said "I don't work here, but this is the best French restaurant for the money in SF!" He continued to expound on its many virtues, so eventually we caved and came in. He set us up at a table immediately and was our waiter for the evening (we were laughing at how actively he "wasn't working there"). It's a lovely, cozy restaurant, though I would describe the food as closer to Italian than traditionally French. The waiter (maybe owner?) went out of his way to be friendly and accommodating.

The beef carpaccio was very good, with a hint of lemon and good harmony with the greens. My clam pasta was on the salty side and a bit plain--would have liked some veggies on there for the price--but had a strong seafoody flavor. The pasta seemed like an egg noodle and was on the softer side. The clams were quite soft, possibly verging on undercooked, or maybe all the clams I've had have been overcooked? Two people got the beef stew and enjoyed it a lot. One person got a pizza which unexpectedly had prosciutto on it (luckily not a vegetarian), and it was pretty standard. We split a bottle of wine which was ok, but I was expecting something more complex for the price. I would have given it 3 stars for the food alone but the service and atmosphere exceeded expectations.
author: Victoria S.

description:
Enfin un vrai restaurant français digne de ce nom! Amazing food, real French cuisine, great products  and high quality even with the delivery option by door dash. 
You can definitely have a taste of French gastronomy for a reasonable price and above everything you can feel a passionate chef and his team at work.
Toutes mes félicitations et longue vie à votre restaurant.
Une Française complètement conquise!
author: Florence O.

description: My daughter and I found this quaint little restaurant on Yelp and gave it a try!  So glad that we did!  Great service and spectacular food.  We shared a goat cheese salad and had the lasagna and pasta de Parma.  Both were excellent.  The creme brulee was the perfect ending!
author: Jane Anne G.

description:
The experience:
This place lives up to the hype. The chef/owner (?) was present when we dined here, less than 2 weeks ago. He was very attentive, charming, funny, and informative the whole time. We were easily there for 3 hours - took our time with wine, apps, mains. You really get the sense that he is deeply invested in this place and looks after every detail. All the wines on the menu are European (Italian, French, Spanish), and everyone at our table loves wine but not particularly European wine. We told the chef this and he recommended 2 wines that pleased all 5 wine drinkers. My mom eyed some tall beer glasses and asked Stephane half-jokingly how much he wanted for them. He left and returned with paper and two fresh glasses, and wrapped them up for her!

The food:
We ordered...
French onion soup - the first time I liked this dish and omg is it good!
Mussels - also good, but not my favorite dish of the evening.
Steak
Ravioli
Pesto Pasta
Margarita Pizza
Pasta Bolognaise
Lamb
Everyone loved their dishes and the ones I tried (pastas and pizza) were all eye-roll inducing. 

Overall: If you are looking for an intimate bistro feel with a lot of "table-touching" and personalized attention from the chef, really really yummy "mmmmmm"-inducing Italian food and wine, for a date night or a small group dinner, this is the way to go.
author: D T.

description: Had a wonderful early dinner here with my wife, the staff was extremely friendly and the food was fantastic. Best crème brûlée either of us have ever eaten! While we managed to get in without one, I highly recommend reserving a table, it's a cozy spot and it fills up quick. If we lived in the neighborhood this would be our new regular spot.
author: Bob I.

description:
Amazing southern French restaurant with an awesome owner. Ordered:

Lasagna
Beef stew with pasta
Beef tartar
French onion soup
Fries with Aoili
Fondant au chocolat

It was all amazing. Tie between lasagna and French onion soup as my favorites. 

Icing on the cake = no wait for 3 on a Saturday evening
author: Eric H.

description: For the price, one of the best food experiences I have had in San Francisco. The seafood was fresh, the service was authentic and exceptional, and each course was well executed. Casual French done right
author: David A.

description:
There are not a lot of places that can give Flour & Water a run for their money. This is one of them with the added benefit of being able to walk in to get a table.

Service is . Food is .
author: Selino V.

description: A friend invited me to a birthday dinner and offered me any place on Chestnut St.  Based on Yelp reviews, I'm so glad I chose Castagna!  It's small and intimate but the menu is comprehensive and the service is very friendly and personal.  The food is exceptional!  I've found a new favorite place in the area!
author: M B.

description:
If you're looking for a cute intimate French restaurant, this would be the place! I felt like I was treated like a close friend that they hadn't seen in a long time even though it was my first time here! They were extremely sweet and made sure I was completely satisfied. Also very polite. 

The food-
For the appetizers we had meat balls and beef tartare. Meat balls were excellent! The meat was good but what really made it great was the sauce. 
For the main course I had the Lasagne Facon. Not many layers, but maybe I'm biased since I eat Italian frequently. However, the lasagne was still satisfying, but I think I would have liked to try the filet mignon instead--which was my first instinct but I didn't stick to it. 
For dessert we had the French donuts. Nutella filled donut--yummm mmm
Applesauce filled donut- good, but took last place in my opinion
Vanilla cremé filled- wow, melted in my mouth. Really good. 
I left a happy girl.
author: Annie N.

description: The BEST steak tartare ever...I'm still dreaming about it! Stephane has a special Nice sauce he makes for it and hand cuts the filet. I highly recommend making a trip there if you love steak tartare like I do. And everything else on the menu is exquisitely delicious! Pascal and Emmanuel make your dining experience exceptional!
author: Christine H.

description: Found great reviews on yelp for this place!  Small, cute  place in a good location!  Stephane makes it a pleasure to dine here.  He explains the dishes and wines.  Interacts with the customers to make sure they are satisfied!  My husband had the special, scallops and mashed potatoes (oooo they were melting in our mouths).  I ordered the ribeye special!  One of the best i've had.  We also started with the french onion soup and i dont like french onion soup but it was very good.  We also had the charciarte (sorry forgot how to spell it), that was a good appetizer as well with the bottle of wine my husband brought.  They also give you warm bread and butter wich is really good and fresh from the oven.  Stephane and his staff were prompt and friendly!  We will come back again!  I think we are coming back this Friday with a few friends!
author: Christina C.

description: Amazing food and atmosphere. Cozy and warm decor. Perfect for date night. Large selection of wines. Must try the Pasta de Parma!
author: Peter C.

description:
A small, hidden restaurant that I would not have found without Yelp! Glad I made reservations (thanks again, Yelp app) for 5 people for dinner-- the restaurant was much smaller than I expected. There was probably only our table, which had 3 tables pushed together to fit 6, and then 5 other tables for 2-4 people each. 

*Pistou Provencale: Thin crust pizza with pesto sauce, three cheeses, and grilled vegetables. Yum! We got this as an appetizer for the table and all really enjoyed it. 

*Steak Au Poivre Et Ses Panisses: Filet Mignon-- was tender and the entree was a perfect portion. I got mine medium well and probably should have gotten medium. I would order this again and get it done medium. 

* Tarte Tatin a La Sauce Caramel: Caramelized apple tart. This was just OK and could have gone without. Only ordered this because they didn't have beignets for the day (which was my first choice). 

*Fondant Au Chocolat: Warm molten chocolate cake-- everyone really enjoyed this for dessert as it was moist and tasty. Would order again. 


Overall, I would definitely come back here for a date night as it is dim and kind of has a romantic setting. I'm giving this restaurant 4 stars because none of the foods really blew my mind or made me feel like I would crave it. However, still giving a very positive review because the staff was great and makes you feel like home (I believe one of the guys was the owner). Anyway, Castagna is worth trying if you are in the area or looking for a cute date night spot. Love, love, loved the level of service they provided! You definitely don't get that level of service at every restaurant in the city.
author: Dorothy H.

description: Wonderful food, intimate atmosphere. I great spot of a dinner with friends or date night. Fantastic service, too.
author: Abigail M.

description: I've been here 3 time . This is one of my favorite restaurants in sf . It's a small intimate place where the chef literally comes to talk to you . The food is amazing . Ive gotten two different steak dishes , cooked perfectly with great seasoning . My girlfriend gets the pasta and has always been happy . Definitely get the French onion soup if you go.
author: Max M.

description: Good food, and great service! The food was a mix of French and Italian. Will definitely return and try more dishes next time.
author: Jane F.

description: One of the best meals I've had in SF. Very cozy place and owner is engaged and friendly.  Highly recommend the fruity del mar. Absolutely delicious. Had the crem brule and espresso to finish it off. Really superior start to finish from someone who is pretty fussy. Check this place out!
author: Robert B.

description: Stephan and team are amazing! This quaint, cozy yet stylish restaurant offers quintessentially French food. All your favorite dishes are offered. Wines delicious.
author: Myriam K.

description:
what a sweet little spot. we were able to make reservations for a party of 5 on saturday night. they were pretty flexible too and able to accommodate. it's a small place and i think the owner was helping out that night. everyone was super sweet. we got:

french onion soup - my cousin got this. she seemed to really enjoy it

ahi tuna starter - pretty yummy and flavorful with what seemed to be taro chips

i got the mussles nicoise with french fries. the mussles were nice and flavorful, white wine with olives and tomatoes. very good. two glasses of wine!

the lasagna was solid too. everyone seemed to enjoy their food.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Why would you want eat anywhere else?
We enjoyed our dinner, we took our time and spent an evening together that will not be soon forgotten. The setting is perfectly small. (Make reservation - they did accommodate everyone that stepped in). And Chef visited our table three times throughout the evening. 

But let's talk about the meal. The wine was full bodied, a Sauvignon Franc, selected personally by Chef for our table. The citrus salad and tuna tartar kicked off the evening like only a perfect sunset can. The French onion soup was a decadent conversation stopper that is worth the silence. 

And then came the dinner. The steak, lasagne and aioli fries were enough to stop any good Catholic boy in his tracks. 

Please find the time and come enjoy your time in San Fran in a very comfortable, yet remarkable way. 

Please make the time. How wonderful.
author: Rolando R.

description: Overall good was very tasty, decent service, but only one person working tables. If it gets busy you have to wait a little longer for food and refills, but it's nice to be able to relax and not feel pressured.  As soon as we walked in we were seated with no wait! Pasta was great and very fresh! Only grip we had was two of us ordered the same exact wine and they came in dramatically different sized glasses, one was very large (which is always appreciated) and the other glass of wine was tiny in comparison and was about 1/3 of the amount of wine as the first large glass.
author: Mandy B.

description:
This place is honestly soooo good - the service, the food, the workers, the ambiance & the owner. 

My boyfriend made reservations for Valentines Day for 8:30PM. We arrived earlier than expected and the owner gave us a table right away. We started off with the Margherita pizza and citrus salad - and wow! The Margherita pizza was to die for!! The thin crust with just the right amount of cheese and sauce was truly delicious. The citrus salad was huge and so tasteful - i dont know what dressing they used but it was amazing. My bf ordered the Fruits de Mer while I ordered the Pistou - both dishes were wonderful. I honestly wanted more of my bf's Fruits de Mar lol! 

The place is intimate and definitely romantic. I do recommend making reservations here because it is quite small. At the end of our dinner, the owner gave me a rose for Valentines Day and every woman in here! :) It was so sweet for him to do that! I definitely recommend everyone to try this place out!
author: Julie Anne P.

description:
It's a tiny place and the host, who i believe is the owner, is great. He was very warm and welcoming when we walked in but definitely gave us our space so we didn't feel as though he was hovering. We ordered the small order of mussels and they were so good. The portions are pretty decent for a small order. You could share with two people and dip the bread in the sauce. The sauce reminded us a bit like clam chowder. The bread is also super warm and fresh out of the oven.
We got the lasagna, which was delicious. It wasn't overly salty and was a decent portion. We also got the swodfish special with polenta and green beans. I don't know what exactly they put in the green beans but they were really good. The fish was not overly salty but was slightly dry when it came out.
We saw a lot of small groups come in for dinner. Would definitely come here again for a one on one dinner. Large groups are probably harder to accommodate.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Wonderful, tasty, fresh southern French cuisine delivered with friendly, efficient service. 
Pour les français de passage et ceux qui habitent dans la bay, nous vous recommandons ce petit coin de Provence !
author: Hans-Peter G.

description:
I came here on a rainy SF Sunday craving delicious French comfort food.  We had Rose, french onion soup, mussels (mariniere style) and french fries.  The only reason for four stars instead of five was the french onion soup.  It had way to much cheese and not a lot of flavor.  Beyond that this place was amazing and I will be back.  The mussels were traditional and perfect.  The fries delicious.  The rose was great.  We also had bread to dip in the broth from the brussels and the bread was wonderful.  The service was top notch and the vibe of the restaurant was perfect.  It is pretty small and you feel tucked away in this wonderful little french restaurant amongst the craziness of Chestnut.   

I am a fan!
author: Cari N.

description: We were in a party of five, and waited about 50 minutes with dishes of one each, and one for sharing. The waiters didn't even hand out bread until 5 minutes before the food actually came out. We were all starving, but thankfully we talked and entertained each other. I can see why people may think this place is great and interesting, but Castagna MUST have a professional checkup on its efficiency and staff. It definitely needs some serious improvement.
author: Lorenzo S.

description: Omg the food was amaaaaazing! From start to finish not one thing that wasn't good! So I normally always get seafood pasta whenever it's available. But this restaurant had the seafood pasta and also duck leg confit. So I decided to get the duck. My kids love seafood pasta as well so I decided to get it for the kids and have them split it. We started with the French onion soup which was delicious. The Emmentaler was very good and so was the rest of the soup. We shared it with two adults and two kids and it was plenty and filling. They had nice hot and crunchy baguette. My husband ordered the lasagna it came with a side salad and my husband really liked it. The seafood pasta was super delicious. The broth was yummmmmm. My duck leg confit was also very good. We also ordered the garlic fries. They are the thin kind of fries but those were also good. For dessert we got the fondant au chocolat. Which was like a chocolate lava cake with a strawberry cream on the side and some fruit. It was to die for. I didn't want to leave I could have kept eating if I wasn't super full lol. Yummm will be back for sure. We literally finished our meals and I usually never finish my food.
author: Rabia K.

description:
Beautiful food with beautiful people. I had the seared ahi tuna, which was cooked absolutely perfectly. Very well seasoned, cut perfectly, and exquisite plating.

My friend had their pesto pasta, which he chowed down in under a minute, i kid you not. This place is definitely a must try if you're ever in the area.
author: Chen-Chen H.

description: Great restaurant. We arrived right after they stopped serving Saturday brunch, but we're graciously seated on the lovely patio where we enjoyed drinks and ordered from the small plate menu. The avocado bruschetta was delicious and we will definitely be back for either brunch or dinner.
author: Luann M.

description: Great food and ambiance. They take care of you here. Scallops special and fondant dessert were transcendent. Just GO!
author: Paul H.

description: Amazing service high quality food and preparation they even made my burger medium rare  didnt tell me how I could eat my food. Charming server. Eaten here before pizza also incredible.
author: Patti P.

description: The only fault I can find with the restaurant is the French onion soup which has fennel in it so I have to pass since I am allergic to fennel.  Good portions, varied menu and if you can't find anything to eat here you don't deserve to go out to eat anywhere.  Everyone seems to have their favorite and mine is Ratatouille crepe, all the cheese plates and I'm a sucker for great Eggs Benedict and order the fruit to go with it.
author: JC S.

description:
Great Italian food with French inspiration. 

What I ordered:
Lasagna: 4 stars - this was a great dish. Individually baked in its own container. A tad too salty for me though. 
Linguini seafood: 5 stars - this could be the best seafood pasta I've ever had lots of seafood and a very good white sauce 
Monaco beer cocktail: 4 stars - delicious! Like a grown up Shirley temple 

All was great except for the seating was a tad uncomfortable with the contemporary furniture, but with the small footprint of the restaurant I get its hard to make it all work.
author: David L.

description: So as someone that is able to eat in every four and five star restaurant here in San Francisco for the last 25 years I'm pretty tainted and jaded so it's very rare that something just becomes a memorable place to eat and enjoy company! The chef made some amazing dishes for us. I am really looking forward to trying everything on both the lunch and the dinner menu in the future! The food was amazing and the chef is superb! Thank you. Can't wait to come back and hopefully as early as today after a movie at the Marina theater.
author: Jim S.

description: My mom and I came in STARVING while walking down chestnut st. We were immediately greeted/seated by the owner, Stefan. The food, service, and wine was spectacular. We got the citrus salad, the seafood pasta, and the lasagna. We never get pasta because we usually don't love it or we get too full of it but this was incredible. We both cleared our plates. Cannot wait to come back here and bring friends to this small, intimate, yet incredible restaurant!!!
author: Megan M.

description: This little gem is wonderful. I had the best duck I have ever had. Lovely atmosphere.
author: Maria T.

description:
Have only been here for a weekend brunch with friends so i cant speak to their full menu. BUT...the caramelized French Toast is decadent!!!!! An absolute must try! My friends had eggs benedict which they really enjoyed and i had a croque monsieur. The mimosas were also some of the best I had...really smooth and quality champagne. 

The place is a little tight though - i definitely felt like we were sitting on top of some of the other patrons in there. Regardless, I would definitely come back!
author: Jeana A.

description: Time for an update. Place still rocks. Dinner is great; Creme Brulee is the best in town. Nuff said. Give this place a shot. you will be glad you did. Service is good, exceptional in fact. The Marina's unknown gem.
author: Allan B.

description: Wonderful restaurant! A fabulous combination of French with Italian accents. It's low key, well priced and the food is excellent. My French grandmother would approve. Definitely check it out.
author: LisaMarie T.

description: This place is a true hidden gem! The owner/chef stephane personally takes care of all his guests and it's so awesome to see. We ordered the house red and he recommended and served us a wonderfully drinkable glass of wine. The special was a veal burger and it was definitely the best burger I've tried yet in San Francisco. The beef stew was also amazing. I have 0 complaints - the food, service and prices are hard to beat!!
author: Steph P.

description: This was an amazing experience! The food was wonderful and the owner is awesome. Thank you for a memorable dinner!
author: Skye G.

description: Thank you stephane best food i ever had. I went there on Saturday and the food was amazing the service as well. Definitely my to go spot from now on
author: Karim L.

description: I recently dined here with a friend.  Our meal was wonderful.  Their Lasagna is to die for.  The restaurant is small and fairly comfortable, and the service is excellent.  Nice wine list.
author: Donna P.

description: Excellent service and exquisite food. The chef was personally greeting the customers and attentive to every detail. Definitely a must if you want to experience great dinning for a very reasonable price. The menu was simple and small but every dish we had was a beautiful and delicious creation. Thanks Stefano..
author: Lidys A.

description:
Chose to come here as a fancy date with my boyfriend. 

Food:
1. Steak tartare - first time having it, so I can't judge. It was tasty but I think the psychological thought of eating totally raw beef will prevent me from ordering it in the future.
2. Onion soup - nothing too special to write home about.
3. Lasagna - I took a bite out of my boyfriend's dish, it didn't seem too special.
4. Pesto pasta - Pasta was beyond al dente. It was also massively undersalted until I realized the chopped tomatoes on top were very salty. However, it was hard to pick up the tomatoes with a mound of tangled pasta noodles, so I ended up having to alternate bites of bland pasta with salty tomatoes.

We shared a glass of white wine, which was a generous pour so that was appreciated.

The service was a bit weird for us. Our table was really small, so we asked to move to a larger table. The waiter said it was reserved for 8pm for 3 people. We had arrived at 6:15pm and while I'm not totally familiar with table reservation etiquette, we were done with our dinner long before the other party arrived and long before 8pm hit, so we were left wondering why we couldn't have the larger table. We sat next to a windowsill, so we placed our table's candles, salt, pepper and bread on the sill just so we could eat. 

Additionally, the people working here seemed to be in a rush to kick us out or something. One waiter in particular kept walking back and forth from the front to the back of the restaurant for no reason. He'd occasionally peer over my boyfriend to see how far along we were in eating. I was really distracted. Another waitress/kitchen staff would come over more often than necessary to check on us. Maybe that's why we left long before 8pm that night.
author: Kat Y.

description: Walked in on a bright, Friday afternoon and we're promptly seated. It's a small place but not dark and cramped. Our server was friendly and attentive. I ordered the citrus salad--yummy greens with orange slices and a nice vinaigrette. My bf had the French onion soup. I ordered the steak, he got the lasagne. Both were great. Definitely recommend this place.
author: Timoteo K.

description: Stephane is an incredibly  passionate Chef who not only excels at his craft but also ensures you get a good dash of the niçois sunshine and hospitality. The food at castagna is authentic with fresh ingredients cooked with love. It's hands down the best french restaurant in SF. We don't dine out often  but when we do, we always find our way to Stephane's restaurant! Merci
author: Khaoula B.

description:
Delicious little French eatery! I had the pesto linguine, (freshly made) and wow was it flavorful, creamy and decadent. It was a perfect plate of pasta (and I am picky). The rest of my party all had the pasta dishes. The frutti di mare pasta was VERY good and fresh. The pizzas I saw at the table next to us looked crispy and delicious, so I'll be trying a pizza next time perhaps. 

Cute and intimate atmosphere. The service was also very fast and the servers were attentive. A fun find on Chesnut street.
author: Katie C.

description:
Sandwich was good.
Pasta-terrible. When asked to send it back customer service dropped to one star. Here we are.
author: Rostyslav I.

description: My husband and I have walked past this cute little restaurants a million times without going in, but a stop at Castagna is a must! Stefano is a warm, gracious and experienced host. He made good recommendations and stopped by often. We enjoyed a seafood risotto with generous portions of fresh fish, shellfish and calamari. Wine recommendations were on point and I was allowed to try a few before settling on the one I wanted. We will definitely be back for more!
author: theresa v.

description: It is the best lasagna I have eaten! Pascual and the Chef Stephane recommended us delicious plates and an exquisite wine. It was a wonderful experience with an excellent service. I'm going back to taste the Crème Brûlée.
author: Joha C.

description:
Restaurant is very small but very cute at the same time. Loved the service, the decor and the dessert. 

Not sure if we ordered the wrong dishes, but my overall review is that this place is just OK and I don't think I plan to try again. French bread is good, but my dish was tasting weird. I had a Salade Nicoise. My husband had chef's carbonara and he thought the taste was just ok as well.  

On the other hand, we had an excellent fondant au chocolat as dessert. Love it!

BTW, The Parking is a nightmare.
author: Roberta T.

description:
Castagna is an awesome restaurant cooking traditional southern french food (the chef and his brother who run the place used to own restaurants in the French riviera). It's intimate and stylish. And if you like restaurants where you can observe the chef and cooks in the kitchen, you're in luck: sit at the bar that overlooks the kitchen and enjoy the show!
I've been here a few times and I've been consistently impressed with the dishes that they serve.

These are the dishes that stood out for me:

First courses:
- foie gras (subtle flavors, served with a homemade brioche. also a very generous portion)
- steak tartare provencal (the beef is hand cut and of great quality, really well seasoned, one of my favorite in SF)
- tuna tartare (great texture and mix of flavors, the taro chips complete the dish perfectly)

Main courses:
- lasagne facon grand-mere (traditional lasagna, rich, creamy, hearty and oh so flavorful)
- steak bearnaise a la provencale (the meat was super tender and I love their take on the bearnaise sauce, it's a bit tangy due to the tomato confit and it goes great with the steak and makes for an awesome dip for the fries)

Dessert:
- make sure to order the beignets, you get three of them, and you can get them stuffed with nutella, pastry cream or caramelized apples. They're light, soft and remind me of the beignets I had in France.

If you're in the marina, don't miss this place!
author: Laurent P.

description: What a fabulous place - the food, the ambiance are superb! A true neighborhood gem and it all comes together with Stephane's passion for great French (Nice) cooking. A beautiful blend of French and Italian, we were with a large group and were able to sample most of the menu - pizza, fries, tare-tare, filet, duck confit, lasagna, snapper, and the charcuterie. There wasn't a dish we were disappointed in, all was perfectly prepared and presented. We look forward to making this a regular stop when we are in the City.
author: Connie W.

description:
Very friendly people working at the restaurant. The restaurant itself is also very cozy which I like. 

For starter we got some prawns that were fantastic in flavor though relatively small portion for the price.

In terms of entrees, things didn't go so well. My wife got mussels and I got the steak with bearnaise sauce. The mussels came cold and also very small. The steak came with a tasty sauce but not cooked as requested (overcooked). Steak was also very... VERY small, especially considering it costs almost $30. 

The restaurant is just too expensive in my opinion for the quality and the portion sizes.
author: Nuno S.

description: Just had a lunch at Castagna on Sunday. Delicious. Kids friendly. Not enough tables!!!! Everyone should come and congratulate the french chief!
author: Arnaud B.

description:
I can't think of a better way to spend a Sunny Saturday late afternoon after some exercise in the Marina Green and Crissy Field than to have a late weekend brunch.  Outdoor seating and the availability of a Weekend Brunch at 3PM drew me in.  In fact, the provincial brunch goes from 10:30 AM until 5PM Saturdays and Sundays.

What I loved:
-wonderful service (Pascal, THANK YOU!!! A MILLION TIMES, THANK YOU!)
-Les Moules Mariniere - I'm talking a HUGE portion..enough to share!
-my Kir Royal 
-outdoor seating (sunshine)
-did,  I say service, already?

Drop on by.   It was my birthday and Pascal hooked me up with a complimentary Crème brulee, with a birthday candle, and some sparkly.  Lovely, just lovely.  A nice touch to make a lady feel like a QUEEN :)
author: Hiromi N.

description: Great cuisine and ambiance! A must-go place especially if you like real good ribeyes and homemade pizzas!
author: Yannick G.

description:
This place is fantastic. A cozy little gem tucked away on Chestnut street that can be easy to miss but is definitely one of the areas best restaurants. 

Their goat cheese salad is one of my favorite salads I've ever had anywhere. Great textures with the crispy pancetta and crouton nest under the cheese. 

Their charcuterie plates are worth ordering. The spicy chorizo is awesome. 

My favorite entree here is the lasagne - an instant homesick cure. Portioned perfectly with delicious house made sauce and melty cheese. 

Their presentation on every dish is over-the-top and thoughtfully shared. Check this place out, you won't regret it
author: Nicholas H.

description: A nice change to the normal Chestnut st offerings. Intimate setting, friendly staff and chef, and amazing specials and desserts. Can't wait to go back again!
author: Samantha C.

description:
Small, warm and friendly with an eclectic menu.
The filet was superb, with Chef Stefan creating an outstanding pinkish Bernaise sauce better than any I've had in years. The thin pizza was also very good. Pasquale a very cordial, helpful server. If there's one area that could use improvement it would be desserts, with perfita rolls so-so.  Overall, a strong recommendation for a bistro dinner in the Marina.
author: Ronn O.

description: All the other quicker-eating chains nearby were too mobbed on a Sunday afternoon so we checked this place out and it was perfect for a healthy salad and mussels and fries (super tasty!).  Service was friendly and helpful.  This place is definitely a find!
author: Maile N.

description: Ordered filet mignon and rack of lambs. Both were delicious! Creme brulee and homemade jam crepe for dessert. Creme brulee was amazing but the crepe was larger than i expected, and the jam was bit too tart for me. Id recommend the nutella crepe instead. The staff are very friendly and attentive!
author: Ho Joon H.

description:
Finally came here for brunch with a friend. We got the baked salmon egg dish, it sounded so good and order a carafe of mimosas (hello?? Sunday funday!!). 

The waiter was very friendly, informative about the menu, and gracious. He took good care of us. 

The mimosas came out, and boy were the good! Fresh squeezed OJ with good champagne? Yes please! Must try, must get!

Then came our dishes. They were great too, I ate mine all up. 

We sat outside, as it was grand beauty of a day in SF. If you get one of those days, I would strongly suggest ask them for such seating and do the same. 

I was certainly mpressed with this place. I would come back and do brunch down the road again. That says alot from a foodie that hardly goes to the same twice in SF with all the food options! 

Enjoy Yelp friends!
author: Sonia A.

description: I very much enjoyed my food, but it was very overpriced. The service was terrible, we were approached maybe 2 times in the 2 hours that we were there. The menu was very limited and we had to look up what a few of the items were. But overall the food was great, the service just needed some work...
author: Emmy D.

description: Amazing food! Had their lasagna it was amazing. Also had the burger and it was superb, not something I would topically order from a French restaurant but I'm so glad I did, became my favorite "gourmet burger". This restaurant is my favorite place now. Chef is super talented!
author: C E.

description: Went here for Valentines dinner and had a great evening out. Service and food was good. It made our Valentines special.
author: gordon g.

description: Forgot our steak tartare, we asked for it repeatedly and they just kind of nodded and it never came so we asked it be removed from the receipt. No apologies, seemed like there was a lot of confusion. Cute atmosphere, french fries were delicious. Wine was excellent. Brussels sprouts were terrible!
author: Madeline S.

description: Ok this place is so good! We got the steak tartare, lasagna, and fruit de mers. Everything was delicious! I usually think of sf restaurants as being way overrated but this place deserved its high rating. Bread was delicious too FYI. Service was great. Very professional. Music was nice like calm and cool for enjoying my food. Not busy at all on a Tuesday night. There is a parking nearby that is just 1 block from the restaurant though a bit expensive at 13 bucks. Overall fantastic experience.
author: Tony P.

description: Off the hook good!!!! We came for lunch.The owner is warm and welcoming and an expert at his craft. Simple menu that is well executed. I had the salad w cheese and a great mustard vinaigrette - fantastic, highly recommend! I followed w the French onion/leek soup and it wand it was delish. Husband had the steak frites and thought it was sensational. He finished w the creme brûlée. He's a creme brûlée snob and he gave it high marks.I'm a coffee snob and had a cappuccino. Thumbs up. This was our first visit but not our last - next we're coming back for dinner!
author: Ottis M.

description: Really good french restaurant. Delicious bread and amazing deserts. It is really affordable, even cheap. Their menu is short, but everything I tried was really good and fresh
author: Sara-Fleur S.

description: Such a great little restaurant. The food was great. I had the Ginger Carrot Soup, Citrus Salad, and the Lasagna they were all excellent. The wine was great too. Excellent service, the chef was our server too, it kind of felt like we were in his home. Will definitely be going back.
author: T. B.

description:
I highly recommend the Boulettes de Veau and the Fruits de Mer*.  Both were very flavorful and delicious!  And if you love garlic like I do, get the Frites Provençale.  Add a glass of Rosé, finish with Creme Brulee, and voila!  Fantastic dinner.

*I was particularly impressed with the Fruits de Mer- Sometimes ordering a dish with clams, mussels, and calamari is risky, but not here!  They used fresh seafood and cooked it properly.  Also, the dish has the right balance of sauce, so it doesn't taste "fishy."  Nicely done.
author: Riz W.

description: A true, small french bistro in the Marina. An excellent Filet Mignon with a superb bearnaise sauce with chick pea potatoes. A rich classic onion soup. Thin, light pizzas. Just a sample of the menu at a comfortable, relaxing restaurant. You'll probably meet Stephane, the chef/owner who is a perfect host.
author: Ronn O.

description: This place is perfect for a cozy and intimate little date. We came for lunch and it was warm and inviting. We started with french onion soup which was cooked perfectly and covered in an oozy layer of cheese. We also got a half serving of the mussels which was more than enough for two people and the sauce that it was served in was incredible. We ended up dipping two servings of bread worth into the sauce after finishing the mussels. We then had some garlic fries which were thin and crispy with a side of aioli dipping sauce which was very good. The chef was incredibly nice and created a warm atmosphere for us to dine in. We finished our meal up with the Fruita del Mar pasta plate. I really loved the sauce in that dish because it was subtle, but made a statement. The seafood was fresh and well cooked. Overall happy with my experience here, if anything wish the chef would expand his menu a bit more and give greater variety!
author: Caitlin K.

description: I ordered an Amazing pasta dish for brunch. It was like linguini with cheese, and ham, and bacon. Seriously delicious! They have a chocolate lava cake with caramel drizzle and fruit, which was to my surprise the BEST lava cake I've ever tried. Prices weren't bad at all. Loved my experience here. Owner, and staff were extremely nice, and friendly. I will definitely come back!!!
author: Malina B.

description:
I usually do not review a restaurant, when I do it's because it was beyond my expectation. From the time we entered Castagna until we left, the staff served us with a smile, very attentive  and accommodating. Stefano the chef and owner personally made sure everything was just right. My wife had the french onion soup which was perfect and it was served piping hot the way she likes it, when she commented to Stefano how good the soup was he told us that each portion is made individually. She had a petrale sole with 2 scallops on a base of Italian black rice, it was fabulous, the rice was cooked risotto style and if was full of flavor and the petrol and scallops were perfectly cooked nice and moist. I had the ribeye with potatoes, very tender and the meat was succulent, it came with a sauce on the side for the meat, that I used for the potatoes instead, as the meat was perfect. Needless to say we all cleaned our plates even my 86 year old mother, the amount of food was just right. I can't wait to try some of the other plates on the menu. 

Thanks Stefano and staff for a fabulous dinner experience.
Jim
author: Jim G.

description: The best breakfast I have ever had, which is a big deal. The valia Grand Mariner French toast is one of a kind.
author: David C.

description: Great find.  On the way in we eye spied the pasta.  All three of us ordered a different pasta and they were all delicious and the pesto linguine was the winner.  City ambiance and  what  can I say the service was exceptional.  We will be back
author: Wendy C.
