description: We are definitely regulars here at Castagna!  Delicious high quality food!  Yes, there are many good restaurants in San Francisco and we're spoiled with choices but, there's something to be said about quality and atmosphere!  There is such attention to detail and pride as the owner Stephane plates every dish that is served.  Great fresh food, DESSERTS, and lovely wines to choose from.  It is a MUST if you haven't experienced!!!  Owner and entire staff are delightful!!!  Don't miss out!!!!
author: Diana K.

description: We were here as a group and couldn't have been happier with the service, the food, and the ambiance. The owner is from Nice and he was brought up with people who loves to cook. He respects food and he enjoys food and it shows through all the menu items. We had the duck confit which was to die for, the fish was awesome, and the lamb burger was out of this world. The owner is wonderful! We love him. Extremely knowledgeable and hospitable. We have nothing but good things to say for our wonderful evening. Lastly, this place is a wonderful value for what you get in the city. We (group of 7) had 4-5 bottles of wine, appetizers, and entrees, all for $100/pp including gratuity. This will be a gem that we will come back to always.
author: Stephanie Z.

description: The ambeince of this restaurant is cute and cozy but the food is mediocre. Green beans (side) were too soft. The loup de mer recommended by the waiter was quite good. Lightly crusted with tender chilean seabass underneath - worth trying
author: Rebecca C.

description: Absolutely THE BEST French Toast and among the best cappuccinos I've had in San Francisco, and I've lived here for 15 years! This is how French Toast should taste.  We also ordered a Salade Fraichure and the Brussel Sprouts with Pancetta. Both of these were solid. Staff could be a bit friendlier, but aside from that, we had a great experience.
author: S G.

description:
My friends and I came here on a random day after running around at the Renegade Craft Fair on a Saturday. It was about 4 PM, and for some strange reason, they were sill serving brunch.

I can't say no to that.

However, considering the fact that I knew we were going to eat dinner later, I ended up getting something light. I had myself the niçoise salad. It was okay - it wasn't the best. However, my friends had told me that their meals (one including a croque monsier) was delectable. I might have to go back to try it again.

What's legit is that the people here actually spoke French. So I knew that I wasn't being fed French food from non-French owners!
author: Joanne W.

description: This place was amazing.  We made reservations on a Friday night around 7:30 to try out Castagna.  We arrived a little earlier than our reservation, saw that the restaurant is a pretty cozy place, and were seated at the bar to wait for a table to open up.  I want to say there are 8 tables, which makes for a very intimate setting.  We were seated about 10 minutes after.  We then gave the orders to the waiter about 10 minutes after that.  I ordered the beef stew (Daube a la nicoise et ses pates fraiches) and my boyfriend ordered the lasgna.  The waiter gave us a quick history about the dishes, and how they were recipes from the chef's family.  He also said that the beef stew was very popular, which made me even more excited.  Unfortunately, we waited, and waited, and waited.  An hour passed by and we noticed everyone else in the restaurant were finishing their meals, we finally asked the waiter.  Apparently the order sheet had fallen and the chef never received our order!  We were both hungry and upset, but the chef personally came over to apologize and the waiter brought us glasses of wine and salads to compensate for our time.  The chef delivered the dishes, and it almost killed me how great the beef stew was.  Our hour wait was worth it!!!!! The beef was tender and melts in your mouth and the pappardelle was cooked perfectly.  The lasagna was bubbling when it got to the table, and was also amazing.  Although we didn't have a great experience to start, the waiter and chef at Castagna made sure that we left satisfied.  I can confidently say I will be back again!
author: Gina B.

description: I came here the first time a year ago.  I wasn't wild about the service because it seemed slow even tho there was only one other table for two occupied. I ordered the Croque Monsieur, and it came to the table overcooked, dry and tasteless.  I had no plans to return and didn't recommend it to anyone.  However, I went back last week, ordered the same dish, and it was served hot, gooey with melted cheese.  I forgot how rich that sandwich is  And the service was better, too.
author: Lois L.

description:
3 1/2 star review for brunch.

Overall it was a decent experience with little hiccups along the way:

(Ambience): The restaraunt was quaint and very elegant. They make great use of limited space and you don't feel crowded. I especially loved the vintage picture of a french restaraunt that was identical to outside of this restaraunt.

(Food): 3 1/2 - 4 stars, could have been 5 but there was something missing. Overall the food was cooked well and it was very "clean" (if you don't know what i mean by clean: not overly greasy, cooked perfect, fresh, etc,) and well presented.

Eggs Benedict - came with perfectly cooked golden brown potatoes. The salad was lightly dressed with the perfect balance. The Benedict itself was lacking. It was more of a hint of ham and you couldn't taste it with every bite. The egg was perfectly cooked and the English muffin was very fresh. Where this dish missed the mark was the hollandaise sauce. It was very light and creamy but lacked any flavor or pop.

Mimosas - perfect balance of champagne and fresh squeezed OJ.

Pom frittes (Frys) - fresh and perfectly cooked. Came with a delicious garlic aioli sauce and ketchup.

Croiqie Madame - it came with the same salad and potatoes I mentioned above. The toast was perfect and so was the egg on top. overall it very good but again was lacking that flavor or pop.

Beneigts - it came with 3 and had Nutella, custard, and apple filling. very disappointed. The dough was too thick and there was not enough filling used for the apple or the custard. They were not beneigts, they tasted more like donut holes and not very good ones.

Latte - it was wonderful and used great coffee!

(Service) the service was good and then it was not.For the most part the food arrived on time and the waitress attended our table filling up water on time.

Our lattes came late because the couple next to us had an order for a burger that was never put in. The (same as ours) waitress came by said, they forgot your burger it will be right out." I would've liked to have heard "sorry, I apologize this happened would you still like to wait and well cook it right away or offer something else." The chef/owner was clearly upset this had happened. They brought out the burger and it looked delicious. I didn't see the end result but I hope they took the burger off the bill or made up for it some how.

I asked the waitress if she new where a coffee bean and tea leaf were located. She gave me a weird answer of there are many coffee shops around here, a pause, and then said, we have coffee. I would have preferred her to say I'm not familiar with that place, is there something here we can offer you. In this case there was not something they could offer (I was looking for the location), but it was an awkward interaction. I explained it was a specific chain, so the excuse that maybe she only heard coffee place wouldn't fly on this one.

The waitress charged the wrong amount on the credit card. Instead of canceling the transaction and charging everything to one bill, she split the bill in half and charged two seperate transactions. She gave us the breakdown on one receipt which made it a little awkward to make sure we weren't over charged. It may be picky of me, I don't know, just another awkward experience.  

I was impressed on how attentive the entire staff would be mindful of the front and be sure to close it when guests would leave it open causing a draft.
author: Ava I.

description: Love the food, the wine, and of course the service!  Where do i begin, hmmmm... Okay, i eat here on a regular basis tho I live in Sausalito, and the specials are just that SPECIAL, as is the  everyday food menu!!  Yum, last week i had the ribeye with peppercorn sauce, of course the yummy salad and bread, and what pairs best of course a Bandol red wine, simply over the top!  I love coming here with friends, by myself, food to go, a glass of wine, it simply fits sooooo many of my happy things in life!  THANK YOU TEAM CASTAGNA!  Definitely a MUST TRY and a YES, I'll be back!
author: Chris M.

description: Came here for late brunch and had the ratatouille crepe, gorgeous presentation and exquisite flavor, hubby had the eggs benedict which were good. Very small, intimate bistro on Chestnut that we highly recommend.
author: Sue F.

description: We walked by and place looked busy.  After checking yelp reviews, decided to give it a try. Thought it would be great based on reviews but unfortunately it fell short...Bread was old and stale and pasta dishes were just "ok".  With all the fabulous dining choices in the city, Castagna missed on too many levels for us to return.
author: Catherine K.

description: I live in the neighborhood. This establishment is a hidden gem. I have  been for brunch, dinner and ordered take out. The food is freshly prepared. The wait team is very professional and delightful to interact with. This is a must try!
author: Dianne H.

description: The Marina's own authentic neighborhood French bistro/café. Excellent French food; très affordable; good wines; cozy; personable welcome and service; and best of all, an ambience that will entice you to slow down, relax and enjoy your meal the way we're meant to and the way the French have always done. We had a salmon special which was grilled to perfection over julienned vegetables, and the chèvre chaud salad that included thick bacon slices and pancetta. Great for a date or if you'd like to have a meal in France but don't have the time or budget. Try out your rusty French for enthusiastic praise, too.
author: Ann K.

description: Some of the most spectacular pasta you could imagine. We had the bolognese and the fruits de mer. The parma pizza was also fantastic. For dessert we got the fondant au chocolat which was amazing. I highly recommend this place! We all loved our food!
author: Ann Marie H.

description:
Date & Time:  Thursday November 17, 2011 @ 10:30am
Scene:  Marina Girls in Long Layered Sweaters, Leggings & Ankle Boots w/ Sky High Heels
Music:  Italian
Vibe:  Casual
Decor:  Intimate European Cafe.  Menu on ChalkBoard.  Bench Seating & Dining Al Fresco
Service:  Young, Cute, Efficient.  Stephen, the Chef, is So Charming
Imbibe:  Espresso Drinks
Devour:  Ham & Cheese Crepe & Trio of Beignets
Total:  $25.23
author: Genevieve Y.

description: I LOVE this place!!!!! The food, the wine and the staff.......you simply can NOT find a better place on Chestnut.....
author: Amavi D.

description:
I went here with a French friend during my stay in SF and he knew the owner and all of the waitstaff so not only was the service phenomenal, they even threw in little freebies for us. So of course my experience isn't the same one everyone has, but I am sure from what I experienced that most will have a great experience as well. 

Still! This was fan-tas-tic! It's telling that a native of France is so in love with the place he's a biweekly regular. I've spent a lot of time in France myself and it's indeed a very rare Stateside restaurant that lives up to the motherland, but this one does indeed. 

It has a good range of options from which it was very difficult to pick! We started by splitting the tartare which was amazing. The chef comped us a flight of crostini and each one was fantastic, done to perfection and clearly had a lot of love poured into them. I had the Daube A La Nicoise and he had the steak. Both were tremendous! The wine menu was clearly arranged by a very discerning eye and I had a very nice red (can't remember the grape offhand). 

Oh and the ambiance is lovely. It's a very small room, but that makes it cozy. It's very tastefully appointed and in warmer weather there is limited seating outside. 

All in all, I can see why my friend is a regular. If I lived in San Francisco I would be too.
author: Jen K.

description:
4.5 stars if I could give halves.

Loved the ambiance of the restaurant.  It is small and not meant for a big crowd but a great date spot.  The food is excellent and the service was impeccable.  What really makes it for me is the service (sometimes more than the food).  I really enjoyed my time at Castagna and would love to come back again.
author: Shirley T.

description: Nice neighborhood bistro.  Food was delicious (smoked salmon benedict for brunch was incredible!).  Such nice people, great service.
author: Ginny O.

description: Not only is this place adorable, but the food and service are also outstanding! The French server (manager?) is very attentive and friendly. I've been here several times and once for our 5 year anniversary, which was a lovely evening.
author: E. N.

description: This place is amazing and my boyfriend and I visit here regularly because of the delicious food, friendly staff and did I say how the steak melts in your mouth here?!! We celebrated my birthday there last night and he made the most wonderful Carmel French toast that was perfect!( along with singing Happy Birthday to me in French:) I highly recommend this place as you will not be disappointed and it is our favorite place in SF Marina! Thank you Stefan and to all your staff for always making us feel like family; we will definitely be back soon! Jenny and Ian
author: Jennifer H.

description:
French and provencal cuisine.
Very nice little place. Cute decor that the French chef did himself.
Home made dishes with very nice pesto.
Some waiters of the staff are French speaking.
author: Marie R.

description: Good food and good service. We had a little issue with the automatic gratuity (we were less than 6) but restaurant has apologized for the mistake and offered a refund.
author: John G.

description:
Pascal! C'est superb. Merci. 

Chicken sandwich with a divine au jus ... almost sinful. Looking forward to dinner later today with my family.
author: Kevin P.

description: It's one of my favorite French brunch places in the city. Recommend Benedicts and French fries.
author: Nick K.

description:
Been to this friendly joint a couple of times and still have an urge to come back!

Food:
+Choice of 5 crostini- had one of each- olive and goat cheese and the calamari were the only good ones
*want to order Tuna Tartare next time!
+Warm and tasty bread with butter- free and yummy
+Ratatouille Crepe- only vegetarian option; my hubs and I realized we were not fans of ratatouille, not a re-order for my books
*would like to come back and try the thin crust pizzas!
+Beignets- these were different from the first time. not enough filling on the nutella and apple; kind of a let down

Service:
Very friendly and attentive

Ambiance
Small hole in the wall but cozy and romantic.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
3.5 stars, to be exact! Came here with a friend from East coast for a nice Friday night meal at 8pm. We were waiting for a third person and ordered a bottle of wine, and got a few little complimentary bruschetta pieces that were pretty good! We ordered the tuna tartare to start with - pretty standard and on par with other restaurants of same quality. I ordered the salmon based on our server's recommendation; again, pretty standard for the price, but wasn't particularly stand out. Had a slice of my friend's mushroom laden flatbread, which was tasty. Our waiter was very friendly, and the dishes were timed well.

However! If you need to go the bathroom, you have to go through the kitchen all the way to the back. Not a huge inconvenience, but it does feel a little strange walking by all the chefs and preparations. Overall, experience and food was pleasant, but I think there are too many comparable restaurants in SF to justify going back again...
author: Sarah B.

description: Cute restaurant on Chestnut. Easy to get in for brunch or lunch. Great service. I always get the croque madame - two thumbs up!
author: Teresa K.

description:
The food and staff were amazing. Perfect wine coupled with delicious appetizers; a huge hit. Main courses were equally amazing. Will definitely return; again and again. 

This is a must stop for the locals and tourists. Bon appetite.
author: Monica R.

description: Wonderful, cozy little find in Marina.. Charming French-Italian Bistro. Pasqual is friendly and welcoming.
author: MeeSun B.

description:
It's slightly over the price.. They don't have chicken and they have limited space for sitting. Food wasn't great. We ordered ratatouille which was good and onion soup, veggie pizza, fish are kind of ok. 

You can avoid this place unless you don't have a option
author: Gowtham R.

description: I love this place!! This cozy little gem offers excellent food and service. I can't wait to go back!
author: Shel S.

description:
Have been here several times with my husband. We have always been pleased with the food and wine. And love that it is about a 4 block walk from our place. 

I decided to do takeout because hubs is out of the country, and I want to watch the Raider pre-season game (yeah, that's not a typo!).

My first choice was French Onion soup. It is solid. To my dismay, they said it would not be good for take out- that it would end up a cheese blob. I appreciate the honesty.  Changed my order to the large Nicoise salad.

Thanks for steering me to a healthier choice. I have had the salad before and forgot what a wonderful interpretation they have at Castagna. The tuna is fresh ahi rolled in seeds and seared. Perfect green beans & hard boiled egg. Anchovies are actually Bacaronnes (sp? the Spanish marinated ones) that are more piquant than fishy. Tomatoes are oven roasted, delish. Roasted red peppers and arugula with obviously, homemade balsamic (which was served on the side without asking).

The place is small, so if you can't get a seat, get Take Out!
author: Candy S.

description:
Lucked into this place on a Sunday night in the rain. Waited a couple of minutes to be seated. Very small about 20 seats. Beer and Wine only. Wine is moderately priced. 
We had the foie gras appetizer. Yummy nummy! Then the Steak Tartare. Super tasty! 
The main course was a cheese ravioli with arugula and grated mimolette cheese. Rich, succulent and amazing. Wonderful fresh bread with good butter. Water constantly refreshed. Funny silver bean shaped salt and pepper. Confuses everyone. The finale was the the beignets. Little sweet for me but husband loved them.  Good espresso. Very calm quiet evening with excellent service. Total was under $100.00.
I would definitely return!
author: Carol m.

description: Had Valentine's Day dinner with my family here. The food was exceptional and it was exciting to see every woman being given a red rose with their check. I was with my mother and father and the women at our table were not given any roses.. It was a let down. I would suggest being consistent with your service especially after the large price for the meal. We were really looking forward to this dinner and the experience.
author: Noopur G.

description:
Ate at Castagna twice 2 weeks month ago while out on business in the Bay area.
The Meloni brothers blew me away. Not just the food, they are genuine, really good people: I felt like I was invited to a friend's house in Provence for dinner, petanque and all! Food: very tasty with great attention to detail in the sauces. Talking with Stephane, you know right away you're dealing with someone passionate about flavor and freshness.
Will most definitely be back!
author: Raphael G.

description:
We were a group of 20 french women of San Francisco.
Stephane, the owner, customized our dinner menu to fit perfectly our needs. It was real french food, with high quality products, in a friendly brasserie atmosphere that we all love in France, at a reasonable price. If you want to travel or remember your last trip in the south of France, visit Castagna and the traditional cooking made in Nice in France !
author: Frederique C.

description:
My friend and I had our heart set on a particular restaurant for brunch this past Sunday, in the Marina, where I rarely venture because it just isn't my scene...but the restaurant we wanted to go to had too long of a wait. So we walked down Chestnut and stumbled on Castagna. When we arrived, there were only two other people in the small restaurant, but it quickly filled up, and here's why:

The service is perfect. Attentive. Authentic, not contrived or hurried. The food is incredible ... I had the Croque Monsieur sandwich that is a yummy combination of ham, bechemel sauce, and gruyere cheese, and my friend had the Quiche Lorraine. We shared a delicious, fresh carafe of mimosas, and everything was fairly priced.

I think it is so hard to find a restaurant where you have all three: great service, great food, and great prices. Give me Italians who grew up in France any day! I never give out five stars, but Castagna has become my new favorite brunch spot. I highly recommend it.
author: Cassandra B.

description:
This place is so cute! We were trying to decide between Castagna and the place next door, I believe it was called Circa, but we went for the more intimate atmosphere of the Castanga. The place next door looked more like it had a sports-bar feel to it. 
We found a spot to sit and were waited on right away. I ordered the eggs cocotte, my mom ordered the salad Nicoise, and my dad got the mussels with white wine sauce. 
My eggs were great, the smoked salmon tasted delicious although there were a few runny whites that I found but the rest of it tasted so good I really didn't mind. The salad my mom ordered was a decent size, although it only came with a few small pieces of ahi tuna. I don't really like mussels, but I dipped some bread in the sauce and it tasted really great.
For dessert we ordered the flight of beignets, which is literally to die for. You will die. They are so good.  The caramel apple was a little sweet for me, the nutella was really good, but my favorite was vanilla. 
Service great, food delicious, I give this place an A+.
author: Katarina S.

description:
Wow -- hard to imagine this could be any less than a 5-star restaurant to anybody!

My fiancee have been curious about trying this restaurant out since it was closed for the fire, and we were so impressed.  It can be hard finding unique and homey restaurants in The Marina, and this one had such a warm feeling from the second we stepped in. 

The restaurant itself is tiny...couldn't be more than 20-25 people, with maybe a couple more at the bar.  Definitely make a reservation.  We were seated at a fantastic little corner booth that was very romantic and intimate.

When selecting wine, we both gave a description of what we wanted to our waiter.  Instead of simply recommending a wine, he brought out several small glasses of wine for us to taste before selecting -- a fantastic touch.

The prawns were fantastic, and my fiancee really enjoyed her French Onion Soup and her fish.  But my lasagna...good God, the reviews here do not lie.  Probably the best lasagna I have ever had in my life.

Dessert was great as well, with a complimentary sip of proseco.

Overall, highly recommended, especially for a date night.
author: James S.

description:
Okay so it's somewhere between french and italian, but either way it's delicious.  I got the pasta del mar.  Lot of seafood, great flavor.  Would only be better if the noodles were more al dente.  

Also couldn't pass up the beignets.  The nutella was good, but there is a lot of nutella in there, so it can be somewhat overwhelming.  The apple is lighter more like apple sauce.
author: Tiffany C.

description: I've lived in this neighborhood for 5 years and eaten everywhere... This place is a hidden gem!! The food is always outstanding, the service is always outstanding and I love sitting on the curb sipping a glass of delicious wine. The place is a breath of fresh air; it's different and stands out amongst all the restaurants on the block which all have the same vibe. This is my bf and my go-to date spot.
author: Christina C.

description:
Food was pretty good, but the amount of time it took to get to the table was very very slow. 
The person who crumbed the table directly into the chair. That was strange. 
I saw him crumb directly into the floor.
author: Geordie E.

description:
The Union Street Fair was getting a bit too much...so we headed to Chestnut to get away from the crowds.  Apparently, too many have the same idea.  Luckily, we came upon Castagna, a quaint restaurant that were not filled with madness and chaos.  We sat at the bar and watched Chef Stefan at work.  He is super friendly and you can see he is very passionate on everything he prepared.  

What we enjoyed:
draft blue moon $5
draft 1664 kronembourg $5
CDP $14 
tuna tartare $11 - this was freshly prepared: cut, diced and mixed right in front of your eyes with homemade taro chips
pizza parma $17 and egg $2 - prosciutto and arugula on top of a thin crusted pizza topped with an over easy egg - delicious!

We were given a complimentary beignet with apple caramel sauce - it's not the New Orleans beignet, more like a bomboloni.

Will definitely return and can't wait to try the French onion soup.  The lasagne looks amazing.  So many tasty treats on the menu that we can't wait to try.
author: Gloria H.

description:
Visited this weekend for a laid-back brunch on a beautiful day. The food was delicious (loved the ratatouille & beignets), service started off great but we waited maybe 25 minutes after we finished our meals for the desserts to come... but I guess that was compensated by the nice weather and catch-up sesh.

May be back, but might opt out on dessert next time..
author: Linda X.

description:
This place has become one of my new favorite any time food place in the area, as well the my favorite brunch place.

Brunch special
Cocotte with cream frache, smoked salmon, and eggs.

Awesome amazing, comes with a side of salad and potatoes soaked in tasty butter.

Brunch win.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Dinner experience in a nutshell: came hungry, left happy and full.  It's cozy (verging on cramped), but the stellar service and food makes up for it. 

Tip #1: PARKING IS A NIGHTMARE.  I looped around the same block at least 7 times (not an exaggeration).  Most of it is luck-of-the-draw street parking, but there's also a Wells Fargo parking lot within a block if you're willing to pay.  

Tip #2:  The restaurant is small--make a reservation!  The two-person seating and lighting give this place a date night vibe. 

Tip #3: Excellent service and food.  I'd 100% recommend the steak.  

Overall:  I enjoyed my meal at Castagna. My only complaint comes from the bar seating we were given (even though we made a reservation).  I don't mind where I eat as much as what I eat, but due to the cramped layout of the restaurant, our seating was directly in front of the cashier, kitchen, and serving station.  It detracted from a nice dinner to have waiters rushing back and forth with food and checks.
author: Sarah W.

description:
01.13.12 || bookmarked 11.21.11

Friday lunch before Friday afternoon in the office.

Quick, friendly, and attentive service.

Coffee + cappuccino.

Croque Madame + Rotisserie Chicken Sandwich au Jus.

Like, and can't wait to try brunch!

Total damage for two: $30 + tip
author: Jenny L.

description:
If I'm going to have one regret in my life, it's probably going to be the fact that I didn't eat enough and cared too much about a bikini body for my few-and-far-between vacations.  I should really just say "EFF THIS" and let myself go.  Live fast, die young, leave love handles big enough to keep the Marina afloat when "The Earthquake" hits the Bay Area.

Because, really, I should be eating a Croque Monsieur every day of my life.  Who WOULDN'T want to have a buttery, delicious ham-and-cheese (gruyère) sandwich with béchamel sauce?  Sitting outside to eat this sandwich on a warm day will make you feel très Française.

Unfortunately the salad they give you on the side (choice of French fries or salad) is oddly salty.  I don't think it's the dressing; I think someone had an iron hand when it came to the salt shaker.

Other options include burgers, savory crepes, salads, fresh pasta and soup of the day, (today's was a fresh pasta with smoked salmon, and the soup was butternut squash), and quiches.

Slightly pricey for an everyday lunch, but also a nice treat when you want a mini-vacation to Paris sans the bikini body.
author: Tori S.

description:
I'd been wanting to dine at Castagna for some time since the fire closure. 

Went on a Saturday night with two girlfriends. We had a res (which I recommend, the place is tiny!) and were seated right away.  Service was friendly and attentive. We shared some vino, the house salad, the veggie pizza, and chickpea fries. I could have ordered the fries as my entree and been a happy camper, they were so tasty! Pizza could have used some work, a little lacking in flavor.

Don't think I'll be running back but my inaugural visit wasn't half bad!
author: Brianna M.

description: Amazing food. I had the best melt-in-your-mouth filet mignon I have ever had (I really can't think of another steak that compares). Reasonable pricing, nice atmosphere, authentic cuisine. Their fries were also some of the best I've had in a while.
author: John H.

description:
Little bistro that felt like it seats less than 30.  The soundtrack is strangely EDM, even though something more jazzy would have suited the space better.

We really like our daube of beef, and the spicy moule was a hit with our friend.  The chickpea fries (panisse) were amazing.  

The steak tartare was a miss, way too wet.  

Service was pleasantly paced.
author: Lorin Y.

description:
Delicious food and excellent customer service. 

I ate many different dishes and all was so fresh and delicious.  Jerome and Stephane are true chefs.  They have a burning desire to make high quality food for everyone to enjoy. It was truly a work of culinary art and taste explosion. Sincerely I've never had food this great.    

The best way is to ask the staff for a suggested dish. You will be extremely satisfied with the pick. I love all the seafood dishes and they have great flavor.  Mussel appetizer was amazing! So great I ordered it multiple times during my meal. Not only is there great presentation but the service I received was also wonderful! I recommend this restaurant to everyone. Enjoy!
author: Yujin J.

description: A party of three of us happened in here Sunday evening where the rest of chestnut was brimming with noise and people this small bistro was inviting with charm. The food was 5 stars . 2 of us were vegetarians and 1 was not. The fresh pesto pasta was the best we had ever had, the chickpea frittes w aoli was the best ever, our companion's swordfish was the best he had ever had, a delightful tarte was crisp and buttery filled with olives, caramelized onions, red peppers and was loved by us all....We shared 2 desserts Beignets and Creme brule, truly fantastic the best desserts we have had for a long time.....Be sure to stop in here for genuinely delicious artisan crafted south of france inspired family run restaurant for a true delight..I'd say Castagna ( Nicoise for "chestnut") is the crown jewel of Chestnut Street for ambience, truly delicious food and a quiet elegant bistro feel .....this will be our go to favorite place on chestnut street from now on.....!!!! Merci Jerome !! We will be returning often...what a delight ...such a find ..!!!
author: KatBob b.

description:
The wine selection lovely, staff are fluent in French but the wait for food is a but much. Don't skip an appetizer - the wait for a cheese platter alone was a bit long and even longer for the main courses.

The food is delicious, and the portions are just right. But that wait for everything including refills kills the wonderful vibe of the restaurant and detracts from how good the food really. Not worth the price you pay to enjoy that food.
author: Steph S.

description:
Kinda slow but efficient, not a good place to grab a quick cafe and bite before catching the bus. Which is sad because that is exactly what I was hoping for and needed in this corner. I missed two 22's and it really set my whole day back and the place was empty!
The place lacks has the middle of no where minimalistic atmosphere. Hopefully it will develop an intimate feel. The menu seems a bit pricey. I mean $3.50 for tea, really? The vegetarian spinach crepe was awful.  I have to go back and eat more to tell you if anything else was good. Easy to say for $12.56 I am not happy. If I had not forgotten my clipper I would have not gone here. Specially since I just needed change and then decided to grab a bite to eat too.
author: Natasha M.

description:
This place seems to have good reviews but I was not impressed with what I ordered. Filet Mignon and Seafood pasta with Tiger Shrimps was the order. 

I was in the mood for steak and asked the waitress if it was good. "Oh yes so good, everyone loves it." It was garbage. It was obviously cooked in a frying pan. Asked for medium, came out well done. Just gross.

The pasta sauce was good but instead of saying shrimps they should say "seafood pasta with A shrimp on it" money saving technique? Not sure but I had to cut the shrimp into 15 pieces so that it would last me the meal. 

For what I ordered and my experience, I will not be back and do not recommend this place at all.
author: Julian F.

description: Run by two friendly French brothers from Nice, Jerome and Stephane execute some very delicious foods - some dishes from Nice properly like the pissaladiere and the daube - in a small, convivial space. We tried the fish du jour - salmon served with spaghetti squash - and the daube - a beef stew served on top of thick noodles. Both of them very tasty and cooked "a point". Dessert was a warm tarte tartin with enough food to share amongst 2 diners. That evening, they were also serving a "montagnard" pizza which consists of French ham and French comte cheese on a thin, crisp bread. Also on the menu was a nicoise-style mussels dish for which we will return to taste and appreciate. Reservations are recommended although there is always a seat or two available at the counter.
author: J.J. L.

description:
This is a small, quaint restaurant. The food was excellent. All of us speaking or French being a native language of our country, we enjoyed having full conversations in French.  We all loved all our dishes. My friend had the mixed salad, other friend the pâté, and I the tuna tartare. All great. For main courses my friends husband ordered the meat pasta and said it was the best he's has (being from Europe I'd say that's pretty impressive). I had the mussels and they were very good. We shared the cheese plate for dessert and it's definitely one of the best for value I've had here in the city. On top of all that, my European friends were devouring the French bread; it was delicious. Service was prompt and attentive. 

My only complaint was he restaurant was rather cold. They explained that due to the lower than normal temps in the city they were not able to get the place warmer as it's an older building. For me this does not take from the food but was slightly disappointing.
author: J A.

description: What an amazing dinner! Would highly recommend! The place is small so I would recommend a reservation for more than 2 people. The food is inspired and lovingly prepared. An amazing Nicoise experience in the Marina.
author: Brooke B.

description: The French toast was amazing. The Benedict was slightly bland, but it only went downhill for there. Waited forever for the mussels - they came out late and very briney/not fresh tasting. When asked about them, I was honest - server just replied "mercí" but the offending mussels remained on final bill.
author: Elisabeth H.

description:
This is a small restaurant with limited sitting, but the FOOD IS AMAZING! 

Our waiter had an interesting way to approach clients, definitely foreign way... but I guess for the food that is as good as this place serves, I am fine with everything. 

We had:
- Tuna Tartare 
- Cream of mushroom soup
- Salmon
- Campagnarde
- Bolognese

5 stars for making food perfect and not flooding it with tomato sauce! 

All dishes worth a try.
author: Anelya S.

description:
Only two negatives: cramped seating quarters and the kitchen was fairly slow. 
Positives: the staff is extremely friendly and our server was awesome for waiving our corkage fee for the wait.  We had the cheese plate to start- fabulous selection.  I had a seafood linguini and the bf had the bolognese.  Each pasta dish was absolutely delicious.  I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a quick bite to eat on Chestnut.  Definitely beats waiting for some of the trendier spots.
author: Brynley W.

description: Excellent food and service. We loved chatting it up with the proprietor's! We will eat here everytime we're visiting san fransisco.
author: Teresa C.

description:
Oui, Oui or Si Si...How ever you want to say it this place is a Yes, Yes for me.  I was walking around the area and saw this tiny cafe and thought, this is what SF is all about and decided to try it.  

The staff was extremely friendly and talked ot me like I had been coming in there for years. They gave me a complimentary taste of their bruschetta and a sample bowl of their soup of the day. (Potato leek)  Both were scrumptious.  I had the fresh linguini with pesto sauce and let me tell you, it did not disappoint!  You just can't beat fresh made pasta.  It damn near melted in my mouth.  Did I mention the french bread?  It was awesome as well.  Fresh ingredients, clean atmosphere and just a great vibe in this place.  Just wish it was bigger.

We all know I tend to pick on the French in my act but I have to say, the owner/manager was a great guy.  Thick French accent but he could not have been friendlier.  Same for my server who may or may not have been his GF or wife.  Either way she was hot and friendly.  Something about a woman that has that French accent......Hmmmmm, almost as delicious as the pasta.....Almost!
author: Brian S.

description:
Came here for a birthday dinner.  We had a party of 7, so we made reservations.  good thing we did because the restaurant is tiny.  About 10 tables + the bar.  We took 2 of them.

Seated immediately at 6pm.  Quickly served water and a bruchetta appetizer.  Then bread.  A somewhat small menu for an Italian restaurant, but had something for everybody.  We had 2 pizzas, 2 seafood pastas, a flank steak and 2 burgers.  Yes, 2 burgers in an Italian restaurant.

The food was a little slow.  We were seated at 6, ordered by 6:15 and food entrees came out around 7.  All the food was tasty and well prepared.  The fries with the burgers was a little salty.  The seafood pasta and french onion soup were excellent.  The pizzas were larger than we expected and very flavorful.

Had crepes and coffee for dessert.  All was very good.

Good food, reasonable prices, good service.  Would be 5 stars except -1 for being a little slow and small.  If you walk in at prime time, would not get a table.  Definitely make reservations.
author: Steve G.

description: This bistro is great. I loved the daube, washed down with a good bottle of Côte Rôtie!
author: Regina B.

description:
A perfect French bistro. We went for a pre-theater dinner at BATS and were seated at 6:15 with no reservations and were able to move to the counter to see the staff coordinate their work in the very small kitchen. Stefan, the owners touches everything and the servers are all professional and had excellent wine recommendations. 

The salad was perfectly made and dressed, and the tuna tartare was not heavy, with only the slightest hint of Asian flavors, flavorful enough to wake up the tastebuds.

The pasta in pistou was outrageously good and the pizza margherite were perfect executed and presented. We didn't have time for coffee and sweets, but that's for next time as we explore the menu. This one is definitely a keeper. Reservations highly recommended.
author: Michael W.

description:
First off, come early, by 7:30-8 pm, it'll be full. At most a capacity of 25 people inside, and that's a squeeze. My friend and I were lucky, made reservations, came in 15 minutes before, got our choice of spot. We picked the far booth seating along the right wall (when you're facing in and right in front of the door) It probably helped us get the best service possible because we were easiest to access. It is a very small place and they make due with what they have, but it can cause some accidents to occur.

Service, great! We had the Asian female service and she was very informative and helpful. Everyone was attentive.

Food, good, but not great. We did an order of the squash bloom beignets, which I loved, kind of wished it came with a tzatziki sauce because it was refreshing, but totally different cuisine. My friend ordered the tuna tartare, she was underwhelmed, didn't enjoy the marinade, but to each their own. I personally just don't like the texture of raw fish, but I tried a bit.  My friend wasn't blown away by her fettuccine in pesto sauce, she said she could still feel the flour on the pasta. My beef stew with mini ravioli (there's a fancier name but I can't remember it off the top of my head) was good, filling, but a bit on the saltier end. Creme Brulee was good, like any creme brulee. Chocolate Molten cake, good, very rich. Get a dessert to share, I was almost stuffed to the rim trying to finish everything because my friend was just eh with everything. And I hate wasting food.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
I came to Castagna with two friends for dinner and it was a fantastic experience. Our meal was great, service was great and the restaurant/environment was perfect for a grown up dinner with some friends. We started with the foie gras and the steak tar tar. Both were delicious and were the perfect amount to prep us for our entrees. For entrees we had the fennel crusted Sea Bass, Lasagna, and the Filet Mignon. The Lasagna was wonderful, the Sea Bass was great and the Filet was perfect. 

Our server was pleasant and his French accent gave some added authenticity to the experience. The restaurant is on the smaller size so I recommend getting a reservation and be wary of the size of your party. Anything over 4 will probably be difficult to accomodate for. Overall, Castagna provided an incredible experience. Highly recommend it. Enjoy!
author: Ken C.

description:
A jewelbox of a place in the Marina District that's easy to miss, but missing it would be a mistake.  Its intimate size and family-run staff (are the chef and our server twins?) belie the high quality of food the kitchen dishes out.  I had the Florentine Benedict, crowned with tangy Hollandaise and generous twirls of prosciutto.  The poached eggs were a textbook example of what poached eggs should be - barely set whites, and thick, runny yolks that create a lava-like spread when pierced.  Few kitchens get this right.  The accompanying small salad and griddled potatoes reflect the European sensitivities of the place - you don't need a field of potatoes to feel satisfied.

My wife got the Chicken Sandwich Au Jus, which is so inventive but so obvious I can't believe I've never seen it before.  Imagine slices of perfectly roasted, juicy chicken breast, sweet onions and just-barely-melted cheese (Emmenthaler, maybe?) between slices of crusty, chewy ciabatta - now take that sandwich and dip it in a jus that I suspect is part beef, part chicken...an herby explosion.  Now have a couple of hot, salty matchstick fries.  Repeat until it's all gone.  For dessert, the hot beignets are a can't-miss affair - you can get them plain, but why bother?  Get them stuffed with Nutella, pastry cream and caramelized apples, instead (one of each.)

Service is polished, efficient and professional.  Castagna is the embodiment of the Parisian bistro that exists in our imaginations - an intimate, family-run, neighborhood-serving restaurant that serves delicious, well-prepared food.  Do not miss it.
author: James M.

description:
I'm not really sure how this place got 4.5 stars. Maybe because most of the reviews seem to be for dinner and not as much for brunch, but thought I'd give it a shot.

When we came in, I think we were both a little shocked at the service. Not that the staff weren't nice, but can you say SLOWWW???? There were only 3-4 other tables there and we had to ask for a cup of coffee twice. When we reminded them, we noticed they didn't even begin to pour the coffee yet even though there was a server just standing there. Odd.

The french onion soup is good though - really cheesy and PIPING hot!! (definitely blow on this before you burn your tongue). We got the classic crepe and eggs benedict. The eggs benedict looked good and the classic crepe was really, really cheesy. It almost felt like there was no eggs and ham, just cheese. Both came with a huge salad which was lightly dressed with a yummy dressing. I'd go back for the salad, but not sure about the main highlight of the dishes, so not sure if that's a good thing....

Would give Castagna another shot, but more likely dinner this time. Brunch is a no go.
author: Angela S.

description:
What a lovely little place.  We went on Bastille Night and it was exactly what you would hope for: great service, terrific food, delish wine, real french people and some French anthom singing.  Both the soups we tried were good: the french onion soup as well as the tomato fennel soup.  The fruit de mer pasta - was really good and I likd so much how it wasn't glitzed up - that the simple ingredients really spoke for themselves.  

My favorite component of this restaurant was the sense of pride the staff had for their restaurant, their food and how much they treated you like you were in their house.  I would go back in a heartbeat, and this time I will try save some room for the chestnut crepe - which I have yet to try!
author: Jenn D.

description:
We were looking for a quiet restaurant to enjoy conversation and some wine...and if course good food. Found this gem while walking up and down Chestnut, turning down wait times at the more trendy places. The restaurant had tables and not a crowd so we went in. 

Great service with great recommendations on wine and food. We both had the ratatouille galette with chickpea crepes. They were wonderful...melt in your mouth delicious. 

I will definitely be back!
author: Mary J.

description:
I really like how they redecorated this place. The salt and pepper shakers are kind of weird though.
Food is excellent. It's really refreshing to see some decent spots on chestnut! 
Today I tried the brunch. Eggs cocotte with salmon. Delicious ! Coffee was good. 
I will be back for sure.  Can't wait to try the new dinner menu!
author: S G.

description:
I have been to Castagna multiple times and each time has been fantastic. I have had many of the appetizers and I especially love the French onion soup, and then for mains every thing from the mussels to the home made pasta is delicious. Oh and the bread and butter-- amazing, wine selection is well thought out, and the chocolate lava desert is the best lava cake I've ever had (and I have had a lot)

The service is great, the entire staff are fun, nice and accommodating.
author: Sarah R.

description: Great little spot for a few drinks and a meal! Service was excellent!!! Would definitely recommend the chocolate souffle!
author: Unsatisfied C.

description:
Meh.  So many better options in the area.

Food: Average (is it french or italian? a bit of an identity crisis)
Service: Good (quick with the refills and food came out fast)
Decor/Atmosphere: More of a small fast casual atmosphere, than the prices on the menu
Value: Over priced for the lack luster atmosphere and mediocre food
author: Sara M.

description: Had the French onion soup, mussels marinara, chicken sandwich as juis, and French fries provencale. All was really good, especially the French onion soup, steaming hot, really nice cheese. The chicken sandwich was amazing, with great little salad on the side. Mussels are solid, great marinara sauce, fresh herbs, fresh onion. Amazing. Only drawback: first people in the restaurant, but the last ones to be served. That could be improved on, but I felt that in general they were nice, friendly, and took good care of us :)
author: Stefan S.

description:
This place is a total neighborhood gem.  Eat there once and you'll fall madly in love with everything about Castagna.  I'm a San Francisco native and Marina local and this is my absolute favorite spot in the city right now.

Jerome and Stephan, the brothers from Nice who run this place, are fantastic.  Everyone who works here is cheerful, friendly, and knowledgable.  The service is always superb.   

The best way to experience Castagna for the first time is to order whatever special Stephan has crafted that day.  It's often a recipe the brothers brought with them from Nice.  On a recent trip, the special was a Linguini with beef stew - one of their grandmother's recipes - and it was one of the best pastas we've ever had!  Another time the special was a delicious pasta with chanterelle mushrooms and it was melt-in-your-mouth amazing.

You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu here.  Two of my favorites are the mussels Poulette (order with fries, trust me) and the Linguini a la Bolognese.  Although, I order whatever they tell me to try and have yet to be disappointed.  The desserts there are top notch as well.  

Definitely recommend!
author: Liz Y.

description: Service was ok. Food was mediocre. Got the veggie pizza, tuna tartare, and pesto pasta; all were meh. So many great restaurants in the Marina, will not be wasting my time here again.
author: phyllis g.

description: Lovely little spot for brunch and lunch. Probably dinner too but I haven't been yet. 8 out of 10 dishes we've tried have been great. (Skip the Croque.) service is warm and efficient. Wine list good but not great. Carafe of mimosas with fresh squeezed oj dangerously drinkable and quite generous. Highlights: French toast, Benedicts, carbonara, rotisserie chicken sandwich, quiche - all so yummy.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Scrambled.

Eric Prydz scrambled my mind: http://youtu.be/2KLHbySU9wk

Castagna scrambled my ratatouille.

Specifically with egg whites. Greens and bread on the side. Each fantastic bite helped replenish the night before.

Very friendly and welcome staff. Very charming and comfortable space.

Enjoying a smooth Americano while embracing the Chestnut Street breeze through an open window, I thought to myself this is indeed  how we survive
author: Jason B.

description: Great food, great service.  Good for breakfast lunch or dinner.  It's February and we are comfortable outside under the heatlamps.
author: Neal M.

description: The Tuna Tartare was very tasty.  I also had the "moules" Mariniere. I had the large portion, and it was very tasty as well.  The onion soup was very good. Extremely cheesy, which is JUST the way I love it. My wife ordered it, but couldn't finish it.... too bad for her... great win for me ! :-)   My wife had the foie gras, which was good. She also had the beignets, which were 'ok'. The coffee was not very good. We were both disappointed with the coffee.  I was a big thumbs up, my wife was an 'ok' for the restaurant.
author: Andy W.

description:
Castagna is a very friendly place to eat at. This probably one of the best restaurant at the Marina. Musle or pizza, croque monsieur or the delicious fries, you can't go wrong with any of those! Guess what the desert are awsome too, crepes, creme brulee, etc... This is a family business who cares very much about their food!
By the way the past for the Pizza is made a day in advance! Yes, they do care about what you eat there!
author: Eric M.

description:
Cute place!  The owner is very friendly and quite hilarious.
The food is great.  Very fresh ingredients.  Looking forward to go again!
author: Mindy H.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the neighborhood, until my last visit. Last week, I was not greeted by the man I have known to run the restaurant (thick French accent and always lovely.) Instead for the evening, I was greeted by a different gentleman who was certainly not as friendly AND after finishing our meal ASKED US TO LEAVE because other people were waiting. We were sitting at the bar for maybe 10 minutes after finishing our meal and were asked to leave. I have NEVER  had this happen in San Francisco and NEVER in a French restaurant. Also, although we had reminded the same gentleman that we were waiting for my friends lasagna (because my entree had arrive), he, about 15 minutes late put the lasgna in the oven. I have ALWAYS  love this little gem, but am super disappointed with my last experience. Crossing my fingers they can improve.
author: Beth O.

description: Hyped up!  I'd really give it 2.5 stars.  The service was good but the food was nothing special.
author: Pete P.

description: Love this place. Delicious, authentic French food, great service and very reasonable prices. We just had a great dinner for $60 per person including booze. No dessert this time, but we've had it before and it's also fantastic.
author: Ran M.

description:
What a great find.  My fiancé and I were going to head over to Pacific Catch tonight but decided to try this place out.  We're so glad we did.  I was pleasantly surprised that it was french cuisine.  The food was great and authentic! It was simple but I really felt like I was at a Paris cafe that isn't fancy but all about the food.  

The staff was super nice and all French.  Yes...French people are nice! The other guest were all laid back.  We all talked to one another and laughed.  It was a great experience. 

We can't wait to go back.
author: Lexie S.

description:
La nourriture était magnifique! 

I will describe Castagna as the perfect neighborhood French Bistro :) Authentic & simple yet outstanding. This is one of those places that I wish will be around for years! 

I've dined here for breakfast, lunch and dinner and I was impressed each time. 

*Excellent Staff
*Good Wine
*Excellent Food 
  French Onion Soup (something to write home about)
  Moules Marinieres et frites 
  Linguini au Pistou (Pasta was outstanding)
  Steak au Poivre

Would like to note two things:
I.  There's no such thing as "too much cheese"
II. Castagna reminded me of this quote 
 "In character, in manner, in style, in all things, the supreme excellence is simplicity.

Will definitely be back!!!
author: Christina D.

description: This place is a gem. Little French gem. I will definitely come back for more crepes, croque madame, and great French atmosphere.
author: Olga B.

description:
Castagna is an elegantly simple French/Italian restaurant with a comfortable and relatively inexpensive menu. Food like the salmon and french onion soup are hearty and delicious.

 At the risk of judgement, I admit that my favorite dish was their classic burger. At medium rare, it was glowing with a buttery and melted hunk of brie that oozed over the delicious and fatty meat. With all of this held between a thick and crusty ciabatta roll, I once again found divinity somewhere off of Chestnut street.
 
Only this time I was sober.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Went to Castagna for the first time last night and was delighted to see that the owners are the former owners of Cassis, which used to be one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I was so sad when it closed down but now am happy again that they opened a new restaurant.

Let's cut to the important stuff:

The Steak au Poivre was the BEST I've had since moving out of Paris (lived there for 18 years and had my fair share of delicious steaks). Get it medium-rare or go home.

My friend had one too and said it was the best steak he had in the city.

The owners and waitress are super friendly and care about what you think about the food. 

I will be back soon!
author: Alexandre T.

description: I've had two excellent experiences with Castagna, both take-out meals.  Each time, the meal has been prepared quickly, and packaged very well.  The items we have ordered & enjoyed include their lasagna, linguine with pesto, and a parma pizza.  Everything has been good or better- in particular the pesto which is really excellent.  I feel we have not given the menu a very good sampling, and I hope to dine in their restaurant soon and try the more 'French style' entrees, as the staff are all French speakers...I'll be back for sure.
author: Andy S.

description:
This place is an awesome little spot with great food. The waiter there is very friendly and does a great job of describing the dishes. My first time in here was because the Pacific Catch and Tacolicious were packed and I'm glad it forced our hand. 

The lasagna is ridiculously good. If you're looking for an awesome pasta dish, try it out. Also the bolognese is delish.

My girlfriend and I have gotten the Regina pizza almost everytime we have gone. The egg on top is over the top. Love when you cut into it and the yolk gets all over the pie. Sooooo good. 

Don't forget to get your sweet tooth on and get the fondant au chocolat. Basically a molten lava cake made to order. Hits the spot.
author: Austin H.

description:
We found this place through yelp during our spontaneous San Francisco night.  I'm sure glad we did.  My wife and I really loved the atmosphere!  A small little restaurant with a very personal feel.  You can see the chef adding the finishing touches to your dish right before it comes out.  

The french onion soup was simply amazing.  Everything is made to order so expect to wait a little longer than usual for your meal, but trust us, it's definitely worth it.  We can't wait to visit Castagna again!
author: Omar N.

description: Great place for brunch. I had quiche Lorraine and it was delicious. My bf was happy with his eggs Benedict as well.
author: Aigerim D.

description: Small portions but delicious food. I had the sea bass and my husband had the beef with ravioli. Both were good. I recommend this sweet little French place!
author: Merve A.

description:
This place is not bad, but the parking is horrible. We orbited for so long that we got dizzy.

The servers here are very friendly and accommodating. The food will not fill you up, so get a LOT of appetizers.

The parking is a serious nightmare. We could not find a parking for almost thirty minutes and we were soooo worried about our reservation.
author: Romer C.

description: Amazing restaurant! Friendly staff and delicious food. We prdered a fig arugula and prociutto salad which was delicious. As an entree i ordered steak tartare which was fabulous, well seasoned and so tasty.  My gf ordered the pasta fruto di mare which was so yummy too. Highly recommend it :)
author: Maria C.

description:
Great French restaurant that bears an essence of authentic.  From my two experiences, it appears all the kitchen and wait staff are French, bringing their passion for food from their Parisian homeland.  
On our last visit my wife and I had the baked brussels sprouts and seafood linguini, paired with a glass of Bordeaux.  Both entrees were rich and hearty and shouldn't disappoint your French palate 

This place is not cheap, but you won't walk away feeling ripped off either.
author: Todd N.

description:
Yum-o! I love how this place is cozy, contemporary, and clean. The ambience is relaxed, yet very classy, very french.

The food is delish. For a small place, I was not expecting an amuse bouche, which was tasty. The lasagna had the perfect balance of creamy salty and even savory-sweet. I had the chocolate fondant for dessert. I never have dessert when eating out. I loved every bite of it. I even loved the cafe mocha. 

Service was good, food was good. A bit on the pricey side, but when you're out in the city, I'd pay a pretty penny for quality food any day.
author: Jason S.

description: Lovely spot on Chestnut! Great French food from Nice, owners Jerome and Stephane are very charismatic and passionate about their restaurant, great wine selection, decent price and service and kitchen is getting back up to speed after a fire shut the place down for a year. I recommend sitting at the bar and chatting with the owner who is a ton of fun! It's an experience that's well worth the wait on nights the kitchen gets backed up.
author: Ashley P.

description:
The saving grace of this place is the staff - they were very friendly.  Unfortunately the food was not very good - not horrible, but definitely not worth the price.  Me and 4 friends went there.  Dishes:
French Onion Soup - way too much cheese
Burger - way too messy/hard to eat, weird bread
Fries - tasty
Pasta Bolognese - creamier than I'm used to.  Ok, but not all that flavorful or what I was hoping for
Duck - I didn't try this, but my friend said it wasn't all that great
Can't remember what else we head, but nothing else was all that great.   I probably won't go back here.
author: Angela R.

description:
What a find!! Found this place looking for somewhere to eat around Marina, and wow!! The best chocolate lava cake I have EVER had in my life!!!

It was so cozy inside with warm lighting and a simple but elegant feel. It seemed like all the tables were booked, but as walk-ins, we were seated at the "bar", which honestly seemed much better than a table, because you could watch all the action! The chefs put finishing touches on everything and really put effort into making the dishes fabulous.

The place is run by these two brothers from Nice, France, and it's not an act - their hairdos, mannerisms, accents, and impeccable taste in food are the real deal!

I got a burger, which sounds simple, but the meat was juicy and tender and the salad it came with paired very nicely. And the chocolate lava cake is to die for! I really don't think I've had a better dessert in my life.

Check it out! One of the few truly five star places I've eaten at in SF so far :)
author: Suejung S.

description:
I went to Castagna last night for my first time.  My friend and I enjoyed a nice dinner.

The service is great!  Very attentive and nice.  The owner (I believe) allowed us to try a couple different wines before selecting our chosen glasses.

We both had salads to start - I had the Salade Fraicheur - which was refreshing, light and was a huge portion.  My friend had the salad with goat cheese - which she really liked as well.

For entrees we had the Pesto pasta and the Steak Frites.  My friend loved her pasta.  The steak was good - not great.  Amazing peppercorn sauce.. but just not the perfect cut of meat (or not cooked perfectly).  Either way, it was good, but not the best.  It was served with delicious skinny french fries.

All in all we had a great time.  The only semi-negative comment I have is the size of the restaurant - it's very small.  So plan on sitting very close to your neighbors or at a high table on the side (which is not the most comfortable).  I imagine it will be great sitting outside, once the weather is a little nicer.

I will probably go back at some point (as I hear their brunch rocks)!
author: Brittany B.

description:
Voila!  A French/Italian restaurant that is comfortable, sleek, and delicious.  

The staff is really friendly and are eager to help accommodate my dietary needs (vegetarian).

Also, it's not that expensive for a French/Italian restaurant with fresh ingredients and generous servings.
author: Dominique T.

description: My son brought us here for dinner.   Food and service were excellent.   The filet mignon was cooked to perfection.   Steak tartar appetizer was out of this world.  Can't go wrong here. Pascual took great care of us and was treats every table as if they are the only one in the restaurant.
author: Gerrit H.

description:
service was excellent and really gave me a good first impression of the place. it's small, and we didn't have a reservation, so we were told that there was a wait. but once the manager took one look at us (two pregnant women...), he made room by shuffling around a couple tables so that they could still accommodate the reservations coming after us -- very sweet :)

crostini were perfect, artichoke pesto was my fav. lasagna was served in a cute little cast iron grill with a side salad, which made for a non-heavy brick-in-my-gut satisfaction afterwards. the fried squash blossoms were unique and paired well with the homemade dip.

cute, romantic, cozy place for a casual to semi-fancy night out.
author: Sarah Y.

description: Seriously cute restaurant. Very small and intimate. We sat outside to people watch, which was great fun. My dining companion was thrilled with her fresh linguini and creamy pesto (pine nuts, basil, reggiano, garlic). I had the appetizer size, beautifully presented salade nicoise with wonderful seared ahi tuna. The pommes frites, served with aïoli were perfection in fulfilling a salty food craving. Would definitely try this restaurant again when in the neighborhood.
author: Holly N.

description: Good food, although a bit pricey. I liked it better before the fire. Pesto dish and steak/fries are delicious. Recently had my favorite thing on the menu: spare rib stew with raviolis. Must have. Skip dessert and get a cupcake down the street.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Been waiting for a place just like this in SF--simple, traditional, fresh and DELICIOUS southern French food.  I am a happy member of the clean plate club!  My dinner last night:  eggplant puree soup, onion tart, and the most perfect duck confit that has ever passed my lips.  The owners (brothers from Nice) are adorable and clearly take pride in what they do.  The interior is very cute--nautical/coastline vibe.  
     Lunch equally as good--quiches and pizzas.  Haven't tried anything sweet yet but people apparently love the crepes and beignets.
     I say ALLONS-Y!
author: Julie E.

description: The sea bass dinner was outstanding and the apple  crisp exceptional. We liked or dinner so much that we came back two nights later for another. The menu is French with a modern twist.  You'll find innovative, interesting cuisine at its best.
author: Olga K.

description: Love this place.  It is our favorite neighborhood go to place.  Food is yummy.. Owners are friendly. Not a scene.
author: M R G.

description:
happened to stumble upon this place for dinner since the wait at delarosa was over an hour.

happy to have found it because we had a great meal; highlights were the friendly staff, in particular the chefs who made a point to come out and check on us and even gave us complimentary, delicious duck/pork pâté (i don't usually eat duck but it was really good), the pasta special with scallops and the panna cotta.

yum!
author: Jae C.

description:
Nom. Nom. Nom. Those are three words that describe this place. I came here for Sunday brunch/lunch with a group of friends, and we all walked away happy and deliciously full. 

I had eggs Benedict, a brunch classic, and it was a particularly fine example of this dish, with tasty Canadian bacon, a crispy English muffin, perfectly soft eggs, and lots of luscious hollandaise sauce. I also had a cappuccino, which I am happy to report was very good (not quite Milan good, but certainly authentic) as were all the espresso drinks my party ordered (latte, espresso, mocha, etc.). 

Two of my friends got the French toast, which was divine, and another friend got the croque Madame, which was delicious (the bread is really good, as is their cheese choice). My last friend got a hamburger, which I understand was good, as were the divinely crispy shoestring fries that came with it. 

The wait staff are friendly (we were served by a Marisa Tomei look-alike) and very attentive, and overall I was very happy about the whole experience.
author: Leslie I.

description: A quaint little French restaurant in the Marina, it is well worth a visit. All around great food and service. Highly enjoyed the Steak Tartare and pasta. The wine list is small, but reasonably priced. Would suggest a reservation as there is limited seating. Been to Castagna at least a dozen times, and always a very good experience.
author: James A.

description: Love this place.  The chef is impressive and cares about the food he prepares - it has to be perfect and it was perfect.  So much flavor and texture - so glad they are back! We had a wonderful time and sat at the bar.
author: Krista L.

description:
Food was fine.  Had a long wait outdoors despite having a reservation.  Cramped and noisy.

Overall, not bad EXCEPT when we checked credit card statements, they added $6 to the tips onto our bill without our knowledge.  We had split the check & coordinated tips at $12 each.  Credit card statements came weeks later at $3 more each.

My advice -- don't go there.  I never will again.
author: Dick D.

description: A real hidden gem in the Marina...avoid all of those touristy places and try this alternative which reminds me of New York's Little Italy. Sit at the counter and executive chef and co-owner Stephane Meloni will guide you on what to eat at his restaurant. I recommend any of the pizza dishes..they were divine a true French and Italian delight! Thanks Stephane you rock! Keep up the good business!
author: Jason F.

description: Great location in Marina district. Cozy circumstance with great food and excellent service. I ordered a Florentine benedict and it was very tasty and definitely will go there again when I visit San Francisco!
author: Chun Jou H.

description:
Great place for a simple dessert! They have some of THE best crepes I think I've ever had. I've ordered both the plain nutella and nutella with banana, and they were both made to perfection (with that lovely sugary crispiness along the edges, super delicate dough, and the perfect distribution of nutella). 

I will definitely be back for more dessert, and maybe even a main dish :)
author: Gloria C.

description:
We were lucky enough to get seated on Saturday evening without a reservation.  My girlfriend was in town with her daughter and a few friends looking at colleges.  

The food was amazing, the staff very accommodating and the overall experience was excellent.  I can't wait to go back and discover what else they have on their menu.  The sea bass special was amazing, as was their homemade pasta!
author: Amy P.

description: Came here for dinner for the first time last week. And what can I say. Chef makes the most amazing molten chocolate cake ever! Must try!
author: Felix B.

description:
I took my sister and niece and nephew ( from LA area) and my partner there for dinner last night. What a wonderful experience it was. The wine list was wonderful as was the dinner menu was as well and the service was fantastic. We had the pesto linguine, the Beef stew, the steak tartare (one of the best I have very had!!) and the fish special.. Sea Bass!! and the Bolognese pasta...ALL excellent !!! I would highly recommend  this restaurant and will most definitely go back.. Prices are moderate and the food is SUPERB!!! Thanks for a wonderful evening, my one very small complaint the music was a bit loud for talking!!
Stephan Wakefield
San Francisco
author: Stephen W.

description:
Ordered the pesto pasta and a side of fries, paid $22

The pasta was excellent, perfectly done and very tasty. The fries on the other hand were absolutely amazing! Make sure you try it with the aioli they provide on the side - very very tasty!

Loved the food, though the portions can be a little light

Also was mildly irritated that I was not served bread when I sat down unlike the other table next to me, hope it doesn't happen again; assuming this was just a miss, the service was quite good otherwise.

Next time will try their pizzas and might bump up the star-count
author: Aditya S.

description:
If zero was a choice I would give it to Castagna.
Being an African girl, I enjoy the diversity in San Francisco. The night of 11/17/2012 my cousin and I were looking for a place to have a nice quiet dinner and a couple of drinks to wash away the traumas of this past week. So here goes the story. Me and my cousin enter Castagna and get seated by this wonderful young blonde lady. Next thing you know this blonde lady comes by and says that this area we were seated at was already reserved and she is sorry about the whole confusion and is it okay that we get seated somewhere else. My cousin and I being all modest and humble and quite the respectful sensitive people, didn't take offense to it and said "alright we can move it's whatever." So we moved and got seated somewhere else. Then after we got comfortable and seated the blonde lady comes back and says that " I am sorry ladies but the whole restaurant is booked and that includes the booth. I am sorry about that." At this point I had just had it with this people. It is something else to be seated once and get moved/kicked out but TWICE!???? What the fuck!? I try to be rationale and not take things personal but that was FUCKN personal! The owner came to us while we were getting ready to leave saying that the blonde lady was " new and in training" claiming that she doesn't know what she is doing but here my question for the owner is " Why did you tell her (blonde lady) that the FIRST place we were seated at was reserved and after all that, when we got seated somewhere else and got settled you sent her again to do your work and tell us that the whole restaurant was booked? Sorry Mr. French Guy but we were only there for one drink and dinner. A maximum of 45 minutes would do especially the fact that your whole restaurant was empty with only 6 customers. I hope that me and my cousin being black had nothing to do with this ridiculous incident and I hope that your conscious doesn't bother you for treating us like that. If you must know, we are good tippers and we intended to give a lot especially after this horrible week I had, I just wanted a peaceful dinner. I will never come to your restaurant or ever recommend it to anyone. You are one racist piece of crap. I may have been dressed down but I am a registered nurse with a license to save lives and I could have possibly done wonders if anything happened at your restaurant. Think about how this world was designed for all of us to get along and love one another without color being an issue. And we are in San Francisco for crying out loud.
author: leba g.

description:
Had Saturday brunch here, arriving at noon, with a reservation. There were empty seats available, however, including a few tables outside. By the end of the meal I was amazed that the place wasn't packed at weekend brunch time, and noted that other Chestnut St. restaurants had good crowds. I think some of the mediocre reviews here have put off people, and that's too bad, because the food and service are really good and prices are moderate for the area.  It is also close to the corner of Fillmore, where there are many parking spaces between Chestnut and Marina Blvd. Most were full, but it's an area where things open up if you're patient. We found a curb spot long enough for a large SUV!

My husband is on a quest for great Eggs Benedict, and he said that Castagna's was the best he'd had in a long while. The eggs were perfectly cooked, the muffins right, the Canadian bacon classic, and the Hollandaise excellent. (I tasted it, and thought it needed more lemon, but my husband, the expert, said the lemom was subtle and just right.) I had a Salade Nicoise that I thoroughly enjoyed. I am in quest of the perfect Salade Nicoise, (Right now I have to say that The Left Bank in Larkspur has it.) But this one was a little different, and very good. The center  had Arugula heaped up, surounded by the usual Nicoise additions including perfectly cooked green beans, olives, perfect hard-boiled egg, anchovies (the latter two better than Left Bank's), and sliced rounds of rare Ahi. Light vinagrette. Very nice.  It comes in two sizes, and I had the large. I think that the smaller version with their French onion soup would make a delightful lunch.

Hot French bread was really good, and replenishments are offered.

The regular house coffee is delicious. Rich and chocolatey. My husband had it, and I kept sneaking sips, though I had my own very good latte. I should have asked what coffee they use, because the flavor was excellent. 

We shared a Creme Brule' that had one of those hard crunchy tops that you have to break through to get to the warm custard inside. This was a good one, and the egg custard had a rich taste.

I saw some good-looking dishes being served around us, including a heaping bowl of mussels that I'd like to try, and some tall hamburgers with cones of some type of fries. All of the presentations, at least, were tempting.

Visiting this restaurant is well worth the effort to park, and a no-brainer if you live in the Marina.
author: Susan H.

description: I have never tried French food before. Me and my friend came in around 5pm. The place is small but the looks are very modern which is great. There was a gentlemen that greeted as at the door. Explained there was room for us for the next hour before the next party takes over, which was completely fine. I rather have someone tell me upfront then keep me waiting with no answers. We sat down, and he had a phone call for bit but we were just waiting for our menus for about 2 minutes which is ok I understand he was busy on an important call with someone trying to book a reservation. After showed us the special and was quick to answer our questions. I wanted this dish that was the chefs carbonara. This amazing pasta dish with bits of bacon and 2 slides of bacon. This was a lunch menu but I came at dinner time. Almost in doubt of not getting that menu item that I really wanted to try because of these yelp photo. The chef mentioned he has all the ingredients ready to make still. Manage to make that dish still which is something I was really happy to try. The service was amazing. The food was really good. Especially the dish I wanted to try. Also be sure to ask them for water because how California is going through this drought, restaurants are being careful about their water service. Overall a really great place. I would recommend to everyone to try!!
author: Anthony C.

description: Absolutely amazing. I am spanish and I can tell it is a real french restaurant. There is a huge range of wines to choose and the service is extremely perfect. A very nice place to have dinner.
author: Ana F.

description:
First of all , it's more French food than Italian. I went there for lunch with my friends and their 2 twin daughters and everybody was happy with their food : mussels were delicious , the fancy burger with Brie and caramelized onion was fantastic with its freshly baked warm bread. The girls finished their whole big ham and cheese crepe and I loved my quiche Lorraine. It was fluffy and not greasy, moist and warm in my plate. 
I will definitely go back there and bring some friends!
