author: Isabelle T.

description:
After two dissapointments from Circa, we decided to try out castagna. Have been here already four times. Seriously great food, service, and feeling. 

STRONGLY RECOMMEND THE ONION SOUP AND THE LAVA CAKE.
author: Daniel S.

description: Great food and nice little restaurant in the marina district on chestnut street. Small cozy place with an interesting menu. Nice presentation and fine taste. Sometimes it might be crowded and a little bit close to each other but is part of the charm. You do not need to hurry to finish your plate such as in some other restaurants. I hate when the waiter comes your table and try to clean your plate while others are still eating. It feels like they rush you to finish your food. Most French restaurant in US seems to adopt a more European service style where the guest can enjoy their meal and spend time enjoying the food.
author: L. G.

description: Such a cute spot in the middle of the nut.  I had the French Onion Soup for lunch and I must say it was really good.  I would definitely go back to try their other menu items.  The service was excellent as well and I love that you see the Chef making the dishes in the visible galley kitchen.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
Went to Castagna with my hubby and my 2 kids after a friend told me that it worth it.
It was just so delicious. I ate the best french toast EVER of my life, I swear.
We all ate so well, even my 2yrs girl and my 4yrs finished their plates. It was so good. And even if doesn't look like it, it is really kids friendly place.
To finish, the check wasn't not that expensive. We paid $54 for the four of us, so do the maths!
Not to mention that waiters were really kind.
They will see us often!
author: Nono G.

description:
Came here with friends to have dinner before walking to the Palace of Fine Arts to see Rufus Wainwright last weekend.  BTW, walk was short and the neighborhood very enjoyable.

We seated at the sidewalk tables on a beautiful SF evening. The food is all well presented with artistic touches to the compositions.

We shared a plate with five different styles of crostini; the tapenade and goat cheese along with the Nicoise style really stood out, but they were all incredible.  The chickpea fries 'les panisses' were mouthwatering with a nice crunch to the outside, but a soft and tender inside and not greasy in the slightest.

We also split the Salad Nicoise and the Bolognaise pasta, both of which provided plenty of food and were scrumptious.  Again, with the presentation and excellent balance of flavors, the evening seemed to go on and on.  I'd also highly recommend the bignets for desert; while the apple variety were still good, in retrospect, I'd concentrate on the Nutella and Crème Anglaise.

I also can't say enough about the owner and staff.  They were always friendly, attentive and mindful of the details.  The recommendation of a French white to accompany our dinner hit the perfect balance of acidity and tart fruit to compliment the salad and crostini.

I had a question mark about the apparent mixed French/Italian menu, due to my own ignorance, but quickly got over it... the owner is from Nice in southern France's Provencal region, a stone's throw away from the Italian border, and when the food and service are this good, why would I care?
author: Jason P.

description:
This place is ironing out some kinks but I hope for the best, and I have no doubt they will outlast the Egyptian Pizza place that lasted in this same spot for about 60 days.

Its a cute little spot, that's almost romantic, service was very good, but the food is still a work in progress.

The good:
$12.00  burger was very good.    Not excellent, but properly cooked and tasty.

The mediocre:
The ham and cheese crepes were almost burnt,  so if you like them golden brown, make sure you let them know in advance.

The bad: 
The Nutella Beignets.  Now the bar was set by Cafe Du Monde, but these were cold and old, and their only saving grace was the finger poke and squirt of nutella the kitchen gave these.
author: Kelly D.

description:
Castagna is a tribute to high-quality neighborhood dining.  The menu is delightfully conceived and executed, and features mainly "classic" French bistro and casual Italian dishes (they are not aiming for cutting edge, fusion, or a New American take on French dining).  We had the pasta of the day (fresh made pasta cooked in a lightly creamy and buttery sauce with sautéed carrots and onions), a nicely tender steak au poivre with a savory green peppercorn sauce and served with light and highly addictive fries, and brussels sprouts with bacon.  The meal was delicious; the service responsive, amiable, and kid-friendly; and the space inviting and casual, yet classy, which makes it suitable for anything from a casual meal to a more dressed up family dinner or date.  Reminiscent of some of my favorite neighborhood spots in Manhattan, Castagna manages to use every inch of its modest kitchen efficiently and effectively.   

Castagna is a great option in the Marina/Cow Hollow area.  Reservations on Open Table are highly advised, since this spot fills up quickly.
author: Chris T.

description: Four of us went on Saturday night. Food was delicious ... we shared five different appetizers, all of them quite good. Entrees were just as wonderful. Oh, and did I mention the service? Terrific! We all look forward to going again.
author: Nadine H.

description: What a delightful lunch. My husband had a  pasta special with fresh tomatoes and basil-delicious, fresh, simple, affordable. I had a the ahi tuna sandwich which was also fresh, with a punch of flavor in the tapanade and a glass of white wine. It was so simple and good, great service, sat outside and people watched on Chestnut, we will definitely be back.
author: Lisa M.

description:
I'm kind of amazed by the glowing reviews of this place.  The service was good, but the food was not.  The french fries were the best part, thin and crispy.  The steak that came with the fries was one of the chewiest pieces of meat I've ever had.  Poorly cooked, it was ok on one end of the steak, but the other end was basically raw.  The side of brussels sprouts was way too salty, everything was basically too salty.  

I would not go back to this restaurant.
author: Sue B.

description: I returned to Castagna after a year and am giving it the same rating for much the same reasons.  The service is great, I like the sound of most everything on the menu but I just wasn't 100% convinced by the food itself.  It was nice, but it didn't wow me.  I had a linguine with chicken in a tomato based sauce, with a most excellent side salad.  The pasta itself was delicious, but the sauce was too runny and the chicken did not taste of much.  Also, why was the Parmesan (if it really was Parmesan) pre-grated and from a shaker, a la Applebees?
author: Norman B.

description: I really want to like this place...like really really want to like it.  I like the people that work there, I like that my co-workers and I were the only ones there that didn't speak french.  I love that.  I love that it's a friendly warm place.  I just didn't really like the crepe I ordered.  It tasted a little burnt or something, it was good, but it wasn't great.  We ordered the caramel apple beignets as well, and those were superb, but it still didn't make up for the "just ok" crepe I had there.  I'm really sad, because I really want to like this place.
author: Quynh-An P.

description: Excellent food with excellent, caring service--better than you'll ever get in Paris. Mussels (les Moules) with wine sauce were superb, but my wife's salmon with oyster mushrooms and potatoes were better. Top it off with great wines by the glass, warm bread, a fantastic salad (salade de chèvre ...), and great dessert (multi-flavor beignet), and we'll return to this gem in Marina, in spite of all the other great restaurants in SF.
author: Jerry M.

description: Great service. The waiter attended to our every need. He even noticed our table was wobbly and leveled it out on his own. Food was pretty good too!
author: Austin G.

description: This place is truly incredible. I was born and raised in Paris thus consider myself quite discerning with regards to French food and boy did this place blow away my expectations!!  We had eggs Benedict, a pain au chocolat and brussels sprouts with bacon. Seriously incredible. Also amazing, attentive service. Bombastic!!
author: C. P.

description: Small restaurant, limited parking options, especially later in the evening..Food is excellent and service is excellent. Although my parents are regulars at this place so we may have gotten preferential treatment. Tuna tartar was very good. We had the bruchetta sampler, which we shared which was excellent. My chicken dish was cooked perfectly. Very nice dining experience.
author: andy w.

description: This is a neighborhood gem. Food is really good, music is fun, and service great. I've been three times and loved it every time. Beignets were not like traditional beignets but were still delicious. I've had lasagna, salmon linguine, quiche lorraine, French onion soup, salad nicoise, and frites. Every one of them has been prepared in traditional French style and is delicious. There's even sidewalk seating for nice days or evenings or for dog owners.
author: Miss P.

description: Nice little restaurant, friendly and attentive service from only two waiters. Everything at brunch was delicious and fresh -- it takes a little time, but is worth it! Overall fantastic experience.
author: Formerly Picky Eater J.

description: Great food and service. Loved the omelet special (ham, gruyere, ...) and burger. So tasty! They were dog friendly and brought a bowl of water out for our dog.  The fruit crepe was to die for. And the guys who work there are very considerate and hospitable! (came here two mornings in a row!)
author: Lisa-Anne C.

description: I like this cute new spot on Chestnut! I'm a big fan of bistro-type French food and they have it all here. Croque monsieurs, crepes, burgers, mussels. I had the ham and cheese crepe and they cooked it to order. It also came with a side salad. We also ordered french fries, which were perfect.  Great place to go for lunch or brunch. I think they are also open dinner. Next time I want to try their dessert crepes.
author: Natalie S.

description:
This was perfect for us.  In the neighborhood on errands in the evening.  Made quick reservations.  Got a table at the counter.  Ate good food.  Had good conversation.  Watched the kitchen work, as you are right there.  Had a great evening.

Tuna tare tar was excellent.

I had their special.  Chanterelle mushroom pasta.  Wife had their seafood pasta.  Both really good.  maybe a bit salty, but good and fresh.  For dessert, we toyed with getting another appetizer as the tuna was that good.  either go with that or something else.  We did the dessert though.

Prices were amazing for the food.  Great value.  Worth the food at that price easily.

Be aware that the place is small.  5 tables inside and the counter.  Some tables outside also.
author: Clifford S.

description: Been there 3 times now.  Everything I've tried there has been excellent.  The french crepes with nutella chocolate is to die-for!  They are the best that I've ever had.  Their chocolate fondant is also unbelievably yummy.
author: Deborah C.

description: Was here last Sunday for dinner. Made reservations thru yelp an hour before we got there and we were seated right away even though we were early and the place was full. Love the ambiance and the good. They were very friendly as well. I recommend getting the salmon, it was cooked perfectly. The Nutella crepe was really good as well.
author: Gino T.

description: Nice find! Small, nice décor, tasty, and very convenient. The only thing I would mention, the portions were fine for me, but my husband could have used more.
author: Outside G.

description: Tout simplement merveilleux! Anything spoken in French sounds better, but I find @ Castagna it also tastes MUCH better. Stephan and Jerome are excellent restaurateurs, personable, friendly, and oh so talented in the kitchen. They have a terrific staff who are knowledgeable, friendly and fun. DO yourself a favor and give them a try, You will leave with a happy tummy, companion(s), and a big smile. Very rare these days, this is a hidden gem. Just lovely!
author: Valorie L.

description:
This place was great! Food was amazing. We had the pichuto? I think it's called... It was creamy pesto sauce on linguini and that was delicious! We also had a special they were serving which was potatoes with cheese melted over them and some onions thrown in there as well. I highly recommend this place! The prices were not too high and the ambiance was nice. The owner was very friendly and you could tell he took great pride in his food (which he deserves because it was awesome). Of course this isn't a place to come to If your waiting for the bus, that doesn't make it deserve one star. I had an excellent time tonight and thank you for the delicious food!!! Definitely coming back and recommending this place to my friends!

Oh yea.. And as soon as we got our food the next 5 people that walked by said "that smells soooo good!!" :) which it did and it was
author: Alex S.

description: Amazing pasta.  Entertaining owners from the South of France.  Desserts to die for.  What more could you want in a neighborhood spot?!
author: Julie S.

description: Great food and drinks and a fun place for a Sunday afternoon!
author: Gina F.

description: It's great, I'm sick of Yelp requiring some long text review for everything.  Why won't you let me just leave a star rating.
author: Josh B.

description: The lasagna was totally amazing, but everything else was just OK.
author: Captain B.

description:
My wife and I just tried this little spot for the first time last night.  I highly recommend it for casual dining.

Pros
-  Friendly Staff.  The waiter, who is the brother of the chef, was extremely nice and made the experience all the more very enjoyable.  Everyone in the restaurant waved goodbye to us when we exited.
- Food Quality & Taste.  Had the bolognese, the seafood pasta (forgot the name) and the brussel sprouts.  All were excellent as was the bread (yes, I commented on the bread).
- Price.  The menu is very reasonably priced.

Cons
- Menu variety.  The kitchen is small so they cannot offer a wide variety of dishes, however the ones they do offer that we've tried were very good so as long as we have a few go-to dishes, we will definitely return.

Castagna is a cute spot with Nice (the city) inspired cuisine and very friendly owners.  I will definitely return and probably sit up at the bar next time for a more bistro experience.  And the next time, I will save room for dessert.
author: Rob G.

description: This chic and cozy neighborhood cafe bills itself simply as *casual* French cuisine, but that doesn't begin to describe the true quality and depth of the food.  We were here for lunch today and were blown away by the caliber of everything we ate.  Every item was impeccably presented and tasted even better than it looked!  I was thoroughly charmed and impressed. And I appreciated that my children (ages 9 and 7) were treated as graciously as we were.  They have a small but delicious children's menu. The best thing about this restaurant is that I would recommend this for hip couples on a romantic date as much as I would for families with children. Seriously, this restaurant could not be more perfect. It's our new favorite eatery!
author: SfMom O.

description: My new favorite restaurant in San Francisco. The food is excellent from the starters to the desserts. The owners will make you feel at home. The wine selection is great. The food quality is outstanding and price s are reasonable. I recommend the pizzas and the burger and for dessert, the crepes and the beignets. You can sit at the bar if you want to chat with the owners, they are wonderful hosts.If you are in the Marina and want personal attention  in a smaller environment, this is the place to be.
author: Eric K.

description: Excellent.  Fries and Mussels FTW!  Linguini was great too.  Staff is so nice, friendly and fun.  A great low-key date spot, if you have a date.  Or, you can go with friends.  Who Cares!
author: Jordan S.

description: This is a terrible restaurant! Fishy skimpy oily Niçoise salad...  With Tiny tuna pieces  / pungent anchovies and a lot of greens with a pickled perfume?  Least and and last are  7 limp string beans  ... the  strange shrimp lie under a heavy blanket of sauce  - over salted main courses....In a city of such great restaurants how sad to waste a meal here... This is a puts the French bistro concept to shame .. Nothing clear or fine or  wonderful here.. . EN GUARDE!
author: Claribel j.

description: I just ate there again last night and it was once again a great meal.  Not only is the food excellent, but the people who work there are so incredibly nice.  The owner has given us a free little dessert for the table both times I was there for no reason.  I really hope this place does well.
author: Katie B.

description: This place is a bargain. Genuine, very well prepared food a la francaise. The Moules Marinieres were among, if not the, best I have ever eaten (and I'm 79, so I've eaten a lot!)---Itr's a casual and very small place that serves delicious food. Food this good at a more suave and large place would be much more expensive. I hope they are doing well, as they are a find.
author: Alan L.

description: I am so glad this place is re-opened. Food is always good and reasonably priced. The owners are so involved and friendly they make you feel like you are having a meal with family. They have just enough choices that you never get bored. It a def go to
author: Danielle K.

description:
my compliments to the chef!!!!!
it was the best quiche Lorraine I have had since Paris. I cannot wait to go back to try some of the other dishes. Well worth the trip from San Carlos.
author: ines c.

description: San Francisco was in need of a place like Cafe Castagna. Simple yet flavorful dishes made to perfection and excellent service. I'm definitely going back there for  the moules marinière and the beignets. They're too good!
author: Rosana S.

description: Amazing. Everything. I was a little worried when i arrived at 6;30 and we were the only people there. It filled up around 8. Absolutely amazing food.
author: Jim O.

description: Service is awesome.  Everyone is attentive and friendly. I mentioned that I had forgotten my take home box of pesto pasta there last time and they brought me a little bowl of it as an extra this time.  The squash blossoms are yummy, both my parents ordered the filet and they said it was delicious and the fries and mashed potatoes were good.  Boyfriend got the lasagna, which he liked and we got the creme brûlée and molten chocolate cake for dessert.  My parents asked if they could come back into SF next weekend so we could go again!
author: Jennifer L.

description: What a great little gem in the city!!  We had the tuna tartare, mussels with fries and Nutella crepe.  All were delicious!  Great staff, experienced chef and owner.  The owner was friendly and passionate about his food and willing to share his food knowledge with us! If it's not perfect and up to their standards they won't serve it to you! We will definitely be back!
author: Christopher O.

description: I was bummed when this place closed due to the fire, but after reopening they are even better than before.  I don't live in the marina anymore but we go out of our way to go here.  The pasta is always fresh and thin cut - something I've tried to reproduce myself  but can never make it right.  My other favorite is the beef ravioli, which seems to be made of beef that has been slow cooking all day and falls apart in your mouth.  They have a brunch menu and looking forward to giving it a shot.
author: Kevin S.

description: I found the food here to be the star, but also loved the cozy atmosphere and entertaining and educational chef.  He might even try to put Socca on the menu.
author: J R.

description: Solid find!  Delicious crepe made from buckwheat and chestnut flour perfectly prepared with proper proportions all the way around.  Moist hot well stuffed crepe.  Yummy.  Love the motif of this little spots feels very euro a nice fit in the crowded bar centric Chestnut St.  Can't wait to sit down for the mussels and a nice glass of wine next!
author: elliott a.

description: I had two delicious meals there so far.  Very Tasty & cute and cozy.  Unfortunately, we had 30 minutes before our movie started when we decided to eat here and that was not enough time : (
author: Melissa G.

description: Great service. Delicious food. Lovely ambiance! Definitely a great choice for dinner.
author: Ijay J.

description: My husband and I stumbled upon this place after trying to go to their two neighbors to the right, both of which are consistently filled to the point of being uncomfortable during Friday lunch service.  We were over the top satisfied with this hidden treasure and I'm reticent to write them a 5-star review lest one day I find the news has spread and my quaint little bistro start to mirror a sardine pack like the aforementioned two  ... but they so deserve it!  Today was our second time at Castagna and we were just as pleased as before.  I actually liked my food even more this time.  The food is simple fare but done really, really well.  Last time I got the pulled pork sandwich but today I opted for the rotisserie chicken sandwich w/ gruyere and oh.my.God. Yep, that's all I'm going to say about that.  Hubby liked the one bite he took off of my pulled pork sandwich last time so much that he decided to get it for himself today and scarfed it down quickly, licking his jowls like a happy pup. I couldn't finish my sandwich but, just like last time, it will be my delicious dinner.  While we waited for our "to die for" beignets to take home, we watched one of the owners making a few dishes for another table, delicately taking his time to craft the presentation ... my husband and I turned to each other and said at the same time, "that's love right there." Yep, they put love into their food; one ingredient you just can't find at most places.  I guess you should go and find out for yourself ... I guess.  Le sigh ...
author: Roni K.

description: I LOVE Castagna!!!  They're nutella beignets are to die for!! I also love the Croque Monsieur - delish!  The staff and chef are delightful and the food is amazing!!
author: Jackie V.

description: Exquisitely prepared seabass.  The creme anglais on the molten lava cake was suberb.  Overall our meal was well seasoned, prepared and delectable.
author: Rebecca J.

description:
WOW - what a gem in the Chestnut area!

We went to Castagna for the first time last night and enjoyed a wonderful meal.  The service was relaxed, yet efficient and attentive.  The ambiance was modern and sparse, with whimsical recipes painted on the wall...but lets get to the good stuff.

The LASAGNE.  Best we have ever eaten. Its delivered in a sizzling hot cast iron pan and bubbling in all its sweet tomato sauce.  No lumps of  ricotta in this delightful concoction - the bechamel was unobtrusive indeed. The meat was finely ground and tenderly stewed to perfection and had us mopping up the delicious crusty sides with our bread.  Unfortunately, the waiter would not divulge the secret to such a divine dish - but we'll definitely be back for that alone.

Aside from that, we had steak au poivre, which was nicely prepared and served with a HUGE plate of shoestring pomme frites. Sauteed spinach was fresh and lightly flavored with onions/shallots. 

We sealed the deal with a lovely light crepe plumped with Nutella and soft bananas.  

Will definitely be back....
author: Suzy S.

description: Great food, top notch service all in a very relaxed environment. I live in the neighborhood and couldn't be happier to have this restaurant nearby.
author: MATTHEW O.

description: Have eaten here several times recently.  The food is really good and the service is great.  The restaurant is run by the same guys who used to run Cassis.  I have enjoyed the steak au poivre, lasagna, cheese pizza.  I recommend giving them a try!
author: Devon J.

description:
This is my all time favorite restaurant IN THE WORLD. Bold statement, I know. But I'm secure in making it. You might ask if I traveled the world. I have. Have I eaten at every restaurant in the world? Yes. I'm incredibly wealthy and weigh 300 lbs. I know what I am talking about. So listen up. 
Seriously though, this place was ah-mazing. I've never had a menu that's so laid out, so well-planned, and so well matched that one course easily flows and complements the next. If Jerome, the manager, tells you a certain wine will go with your meal, believe him. The man knows what he's talking about. I don't care if you write for Food & Wine, Jerome has you beat. In fact, listen to him about everything. If he says your steak should be prepared in a certain manner (e.g. medium over medium-well), heed that advice as well. He's the food man. 
I haven't been here for brunch, just an elaborate Valentine's Day meal (hubba hubba) but I know if they can master a prix fixe menu that made me feel more stuffed than the force-fed ducks I slurped down, then I'm sure they can handle a croissant and some juice. 
Bottom line: go here. Yum.
author: Becca B.

description: Love this place!!!! The food is amazing, service is fantastic, and the ambiance is great. The space is perfectly decorated and intimate. Our favorite local French restaurant!!!
author: Jacqueline L.

description:
While looking for a spot for small family gathering on Easter we stumbled upon this great little restaurant. In short a great find, friendly staff, reasonable prices, good service AND.  (wait for it...) GREAT food!

Highly recommended.
author: Debbie M.

description: Very disappointing and way too expensive for what you get. The waiter was a snob, for what reason, I just don't know. Went on a Thursday 10 minutes earlier than my reservation time and just wanted to get my elderly mother out of the wind while we were waiting for our third party.  i guess the waiter didn't hear me that we had reservations but allowed us to sit a few minutes before asking us to move to a smaller table. However, allowed someone else off the street to use the bathroom with no question at all. Very small restaurant with expensive dishes, no bar but expensive wines with paper napkins. gormet hamburger too hard to eat. Spicy mussles, were hardly spicey. Too many better places nearby.
author: christina d.

description: I ate at Castagna last night and it was delicious. I had the hamburger and it was divine. The burger had roasted tomatoes (I usually don't like tomatoes but I loved these), onions that had been sautéed in rosemary, time and garlic, ketchup, mustard and brie cheese. This was the best burger I have ever had. The atmosphere was fantastic. It pretty quiet but not so quiet that it is awkward if you say something at a normal loudness. I sat at the bar and the head chef was showing us what he was making and doing; it was very amusing. For desert I had beignets. They were the best desert I have ever had. I recommend Castangna for a nice dinner with your family or friends. If you want to be loud I wouldn't go here because it is a pretty small restaurant. This would be a perfect  place for a date.
author: John D.

description: what a find in my area...their salmon is so wonderful...and reasonably priced...their soups at lunchtime are delicious...service is attentive...music often too loud and not conducive to dining peacefully
author: Kay H.

description: I took the ladies here for mothers day dinner. It was a small but cozy restaurant with great food and service. The desserts were amazing! Especially the french doughnuts  stuffed with nutella and apples!! Great place!!
author: Anya M.

description: This little restaurant should be packed every night.  It is the best restaurant on the street.  Yes, Chestnut Street.  I have eaten there 4 times; so it passes the consistency test.  Try the specials.  The tomato and mushroom soups are to die for.  The daily pasta has been cooked perfectly (wish I could say that about more Italian restaurants in town).  The pizzas are superb.  The confit de canard was the best outside France, heck, better than I remember there, too.  They even have beer on tap.  Love Castagna.  Great service too!
author: James K.

description: This place is a hidden gem in the Marina - especially for brunch! Everything I have tried on their menu so far has been amazing (eggs benedict, mussels, mushroom soup, beignets) and the fresh Acme bread and butter that comes with every meal is delicious! Also the waitress it super sweet and personable. Love coming here :)
author: Maya C.

description: Wow! Castagna re-opened last night and the new menu is incredible. Brothers Stephan(chef) and Jerome(happy diner manager) are more fun than ever and creating magic in the Marina. For those of you that dont know, the brothers owned the very highly regarded Cassis, named after the small fishing village near nice the two came from. They decided to lose the overhead of a 200 seat restaurant, and now have a stunning 40 seat southern french bistro which includes an eight seat eating bar right in front of the cooking action(our favorite place to sit, and a great place to dine alone and not feel alone for a second, we made five new friends last night. On to the food, our appetizer last night was a fantastic tuna tartar I cant tell you what was in it, but it was unique and ill be ordering it again next time. Main courses were the dinner size portion of mussels provencale with pomme frites and a stunning piece of sea bass perfectly and lightly coated in fennel and seasonings. These guys REALLY know fish, having grown up with a father who was a commercial fisherman. Dessert was a molten chocolate cake that was light and perfect balance with 70% dark chocolate and also an apple tart that was one of the top ten desserts Ive ever had. The brothers really know their wines and we enjoyed a lovely french rose with our meal. Top top entree price was I think about $26 and the mussels dinner portion about $16...very reasonable by marina/pac heights standard....I'm going back tonight and will probably eat there weekly....
author: Dr. Olga S.

description: Found this little gem while strolling the Marina on a Saturday evening. We spotted an empty table from the door and decided to give it a try. After all, it was one of the only few places without a long wait. I had a serving of their fresh pasta with pesto. There's just something about fresh pasta that screams "home cooked meal." It was a delightful dish with the pesto made just the way I like it: fragrant and creamy. The husband ordered fresh pasta with arrabiata sauce and chicken apple sausage. He said it was really good. While are dishes were very much enjoyed, the desserts were definitely the highlight. Since we couldn't decide, we opted for both the creme brulee and the beignets. The beignets are served on a platter; one of each flavor (pastry cream, hazelnut, and apple). I definitely loved the pastry cream! The creme brulee was pretty much the pastry cream itself with the caramelized sugar and berries on the side. It was definitely the best creme brulee I've had since I went to France. It was hard not to reminisce. We were introduced to the owner/chef who happily entertained patrons throughout his tiny yet charming restaurant. He was French-go figure. No wonder the food was amazing! We will be back, Castagna! We had a great time!
author: Allison M.

description: This is the kind of restaurant that defines a neighborhood. It's a small pocket cafe, that probably cannot hold more than 30 people but the food is incomparable. The french onion soup I had rivaled some soups I had in France. The food is so good. Conversation stops because you are so consumed by your meal.
author: Annika C.

description: We love La Castagna. Moved back to the Marina 11 months ago, and it was one of our best new finds. A cozy, little restaurant that is getting lots of regulars. Great classic French/Nicoise bistro dinner menu. The two brothers  who own it, run it, plan menu and cook are fun and fantastic. Have brought our Parisian relatives here, told many friends about it and they all love it too.  Can't go a couple weeks without stopping in.  Life wouldn't be the same without the chocolate lava cake and the crepes for dessert...
author: Mona H.

description: We were looking for an Italian restaurant but this place is definitely more French than Italian. Still, the food was great and the staff was very welcoming to our party of two adults and two children. It's small space makes it a very personal dining experience. Cute ambience with good food and friendly, capable staff.
author: Michelle W.

description: Sure to become a neighborhood gem. We walked in last night and were greeted warmly in French. The staff is friendly and attentive. The chef/owner and his brother both made it a point to introduce themselves and everyone couldn't have been more welcoming to our small son. My tuna tartare appetizer was excellent and I will probably develop regular cravings for it. We liked everything we ordered. Prices were reasonable. The food though was a little slow coming out. Overall, everything you could hope for in a small, French neighborhood restaurant just blocks from our home.
author: Gila M.

description: Very sophisticated, delicious food in a deceivingly casual spot.    The lasagna is to die for, and what keeps me coming back.
author: Elissa S.

description: The food here is amazing.  My kids had the cheese pizza and nutella crepe which they loved and my husband and I had the eggs benedict.  Just yummy.  I've been back a second time and had their pasta of the day.  Another yummy experience.  Be sure to check out their special daily menu on the board.  I LOVE the food and the boat decor.  They have these little hooks to hold your purse under the bar.  Too cute!!
author: May C.

description: Hungry and exhausted, I walked into this restaurant to be greeted by a very personable gentlemen at the bar. As he suggested the specials for the day and handed me the menu, my eyes fell on the words Dr. Pepper.   As one of Dr. Pepper's (DP) biggest fans, I had to get the cherry DP BBQ pork pulled sandwich after the chef explained how it's made. It was delicious and very satisfying. It was by far the least messiest BBQ sandwich I've ever hand. Will be back for more, Castagna.
author: Ruth R.

description: While this storefront has seen a lot of turnover, I hope this place stays. Nice mix of French and Italian. I almost hope it doesn't become as popular as some of the other small restaurants in the Marina, as I really love walking right in and having a seat. I've had breakfast here twice, and picked up dinner once. Everything was good! Minus one star due to the fact they don't  open 'til 9 on the weekends and close at 5. Could also use a slightly bigger breakfast/brunch menu....trying to stay away from those carbs!
author: Tory K.

description: This place is really really delicious, and the staff are very friendly. It was a bonus that everyone speaks French... Definitely worth trying! Their Mussels were ah-mazing!
author: Joyce P.

description: Came here with my wife.  The peppercorn steak was good and the peppercorns were yummy. We also had the linquini with clam sauce-delish but a little creamy for me, I prefer more of a zesty light clam sauce.  Dining room is very small.  Overall a nice meal.  Only negatives were the coffee, it was sour tasting like the old robusta beans not Arabica. I expect better.  Also, the beignets  was a disappointment,  a donut shop around the corner would have been better, the beignet was just a tiny puff with a squirt of cream...very underwhelming.  It wasn't even warm.
author: g s.

description: The food and experience at Castagna is excellent. The owner greets you at the door and then ensures your dining experience is great. The moules (garlic, parsley) with fries was incredible. The pizzas are also delicious and perfectly cooked. If you want to experience Paris on Chestnut street, this is the place to visit. It's a small restaurant, which I personally like. Has a great neighborhood feel. The wine list isn't too big and the choices are very good and reasonably priced. I hesitate to say anything else about this hidden gem because I don't want it to get too crowded. :)
author: grace B.

description: Great new restaurant.  You won't be disappointed.  The food was excellent.  The salad was not your typical salad; it was unique and well prepared.  I also had the seafood pasta and it was fresh and light.  Well done!  As good as any 5 star restaurant at a much lower price.
author: dominic m.

description: Went to that restaurant first time tonight with a girlfriend of mine and I came back home really upset over what happened.  Maybe it was pure coincidence but it left a bitter after taste in my mouth for its racism suggestion -- even though admittedly we had their very delicious beignets.  We walked in without reservations and noticed that there was only one table for two available. The host/waiter told us, after having checked the computer, that that very table was reserved.  We told him that we could sit outside (he didn't offer), even though it was freezing cold as long as the heat was turned on. So we sat outside. Even though the heat was on, it was not strong enough and it was still cold. We finished and got up only to notice that no person had walked in since we had sat down, that very table that was supposed to have been reserved had no one occupying it, and there were two additional tables available. The host never gave us the option for either. Then I noticed that my girlfriend and I were the only dark/ethnic patrons of that restaurant. Again, maybe it was a mere coincidence, but it was still something that I couldn't avoid noticing. Especially since I've been going to many restaurants in the Bay area and never encountered such treatment or felt discriminated. I doubt I'll go back and will definitely repeat this story to every one I know.
author: Yanni G.
